Reviews.Title: “Good place to spend the night before your cruise”
Reviews.Author: jerseymariner
Reviews.Content: An upscale Holiday Inn, right in a prime location in downtown Miami, and only a mile from the cruise port. Clean, nice sized rooms, with a good view of the Miami waterfront if your get the east side. I friendly bar and restaurant in the lobby, and nearby stores for last minute supplies. Reliable wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: bzmomlc
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews on this hotel and was a little nervous (I am very picky about hotels). We were traveling with friends and they picked it. The room itself was very basic (nothing fancy) but the view and location made up for it. Check in was quick and easy. Since we were Priority Club members, we were told that we would get a discount at breakfast. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced (even without the discount). We ordered off of the menu but the buffet looked good. We stayed there while waiting to take a cruise. Our room was on the 10th floor. The morning of our cruise, I could look out the window and see our ship. The location was great with a lot to do nearby. Across the street is the Bayside Market Place with shopping, food and entertainment. (You can catch a water taxi to South Beach from there.) The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Getting to the cruise ship was very easy (just grab a cab out front). I would definitely stay here again. It was a great start to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: tek1025
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days recently. The lobby is clean and uncluttered. My room was clean and had new furniture that was in good shape. The room could use an update on the carpet and paint on the walls. You could tell there were a lot of coats of paint on the walls. They did say that they were upgrading all the rooms over the course of this year so they should get better but they were not bad. The WiFi could get slow but that was due to high volume. The pool is pretty small but it is better than not having one. The one thing that really stood out to me about this place was the staff. Every person I talked to was friendly, had a ready smile, and were quick to make a joke or funny comment. They were a true difference maker for me and I would stay here again simply because of the customer service I received. This place is where people come and stay for a day before getting on their cruise ship so they have a high turn over but the staff was just great to everyone I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of it all....”
Reviews.Author: sugarandspice5661
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel even with not so good reviews. we were not disapointed. The room was big enough.. (looked like a hotel room) clean and quiet. My husband loved it because he could walk to see the Miami Heat play.. The pool was small but not crowded. I could look out my window and see the ships roll in and out. The shopping across the street was nice with lots of places to eat.. Drug store to get the cruise supplies. Staff was very helpful. Had a great time will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay before or after catching a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Sunnshine59
Reviews.Content: Very close to cruise terminals and just across the street from Bayside Market which offers lots of ways to stay entertained when you need to fill a few hours with activities. We stayed here after returning from a cruise. We arrived in the morning so we were too early for check-in. It was very easy to take care of the check-in process and leave our bags with the concierge. We then strolled around the area and soon discovered the Bayside Market The pool was small and seemed like it wouldn't get much sun due to tall buildings all around. Our rooms were very spacious and clean but smelled of fresh paint which was a little bothersome. The staff was very helpful and courteous. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: qshari
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with our recent stay. We arrived around noon and were able to check in early to a newly remodeled room on the 5th floor overlooking Bayside. We did not experience any of the problems I had read in other reviews about elevator problems or any smells. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Elmo V
Reviews.Content: Stayed there pre and post cruise. For the price we paid, it was much, much better than we expected. Staff were friendly and helpful, esp the front desk. Room was clean and spacey, although where our room was(facing the bridge) even on the 9th floor we can hear the traffic when the cars go over the bridge, I believe because of the steel grates. Plenty to do in the area, esp the nice seaside mall which is about 10 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinky26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn for one night preceding a cruise. Location was excellent. Bayside Marketplace was across the street and downtown shops, pharmacies, etc. were just around the corner. Cab ride from airport $22-$25. Cab to cruise terminal $8-$10. Room was spacious and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Saw the Bayside fireworks show from our window (was raining out). Only problem was walls seemed a bit thin. Could hear neighbors slamming doors all night, families shouting up & down the hall to each other. Would stay here again if price is right. We paid $152 + tax and I felt that was a little high but I guess for downtown Miami, it's OK.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay - Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: Fred C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely terrible! The bar and restaurant has the WORST service ever - the manager of that department must be a complete moron. The pool is a joke. The hotel is old even though they claim they have renovated. The room was incredibly small and the room was worn. It was not a housekeeping issue - it was just falling apart. The water changed temperatures while the shower was running. The only bright spot may have been the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: technosimon
Reviews.Content: nice reception,friendly staff,nice room with all condiments.nice buffet breakfast.free patchy internet,pool,good location next to bayside.main pick-up point for tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to bayside shops and Port”
Reviews.Author: cwforyou
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay, comfortable space for sleeping. Bellhop handle lazy taxi drivers very well. Cab drivers don't want to move your luggage. They expect tips for no Eason at all. Resaurants are expensive. Left medicine at home. Went to CVS Great store got medicine no hassle

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Marathoners”
Reviews.Author: greatone3800
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the ING Miami Marathon and picked this hotel based on location. It's between the start line and finish line...both are which about a 3 minute walk. Crucial for the 6 AM start! It was nice that the hotel had fruit and water out for the marathoners before the race and were very welcoming. We also took in a Heat game after the race and it's also walking distance to the arena. Bayside Mall is right across the street; it has plenty of food and shopping options. However, I wouldn't have selected this location if I were in town to hang out at the beach. It's about a $25 cab ride over to South Beach (or a kind of long bus ride). There was 3 of us in my group and we had one of the larger rooms with two double beds and a fold out bed. There plenty of room for us. Beds were comfortable; there was mini-fridge in the room, which was a nice convenience. My only complaint was that there just wasn't enough electrical outlets to plug all our devices in. There's a pool at the hotel, which I didn't try out. I did go to the exercise room; small but adequate. Overall, a solid choice. I would definitely stay here again if running the marathon, but depending on your trip, other locations may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Scary dump”
Reviews.Author: Adam24601
Reviews.Content: Wallpaper peeling, musty smell, old rooms, dirty carpet, no peace of mind. Don't be fooled by new lobby or website pics.

Reviews.Title: “Total Dump”
Reviews.Author: MissB1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a total dump. The hallways are dark and musty, the rooms are oudated and the shower/bathroom was downright scary! The walls are so thin it sounded like the woman in the room next to us was in our room when she coughed. There was a sign in the lobby that indicated they were about to start a renovation. MAYBE I would stay there after a complete renovation and all the old, gross furnishings have been thrown away and burned! Seriously, dont be persuaded by the low price, pay the extra money and sleep somewhere you can have peace of mind sleeping and showering at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: timmerwilke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January 2012 for one night before an evening flight to Argentina. Our room was clean and spacious with a nice view. Bayside was a nice evening stop for drinks, music, shopping, a meal. Breakfast at the hotel was included (surprise to us) and was a rather skimpy buffet but sufficient. We walked across the bridge to the port of Miami and all around downtown and along the harbor area. As a Priority Club member they gave us a 2PM checkout. Taxi was approximately $25 to or from the airport. We had an evening and day to waste and this was a pleasant place to spend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mntnaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best area for those taking a cruise. We came in about 5:30 pm on a Sunday and had no problems getting checked in quickly. The staff at check-in were great....efficient and friendly. The lobby area looks great. We were worried about the rooms from previous reviews, but were pleasantly surprised. It appeared that our room had been redone recently...small, but clean and attractive. The only negative to our room was that the bathroom door did not stay completely shut, but that was only a minor inconvenience. It was wonderful having Bayside across the street for dinner and a bit of shopping. I do think it is a bit pricey, but if you want convenience for pre or post cruising this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Improved since last visit”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 3 times at this hotel. This review refers to my last stay in February 2012. I find the location of this hotel very good, just in front the bayside and short ride from the port. I was also pleasantly surprised that downtown Miami has developed for the better, making this hotel due to the proximity to downtown, more interesting. Many shopping possibilities at downtown Miami, even a large store called Ross, which has good value for money. Across the street there are plenty of restaurants. I also like that there are live entertainers and a relaxed atmosphere at Bayside. Concerning the hotel itself, it has been renovated and it looks much better. The room was good and I had a nice view of the Harbour. There is however room for improvement. For example, the room safe should be replaced by a digital one and higher placed not so close to the floor, which is difficult to access. It should also be more control in relation to people distributing flyers at the hotel, who are they? I have received flyers advertising for food under my door during the night. I do not think this is appropriate in a hotel because it means people are just walking in the hotel unsupervised. What I have found annoying was that access to the bathrooms in public areas was only possible with a room key. Since most of us are arriving before chek inn time or leaving afer check out time, I think it is not nice to have to look for somebody to open the restrooms for you. A nice touch was the free apples and water onthe lobby. Also the free wifi. I have found that Holiday Inn Port of Miami has overall improved since my previous visits. I will most probably return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, wait until they remodel”
Reviews.Author: teachermama1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre cruise. We arrived after dark but felt safe walking across the street to the Hard Rock Cafe for dinner. (And we don't usually venture out at night) The next morning we walked across the street again to Bayside for some shopping. The location was SUPER. The breakfast was really nice, being in their actual restaurant and a buffet. However, everyone else seemed to have breakfast included with their hotel, but not us. Our 2 children were free (12 and under) with our paid breakfast, so it ended up only being around $20 or so. So check that out as you book. I felt very unsafe in their elevators. Upon arrival we tried the first elevator which just sat there and didn't move. That scared us enough, so we switched elevators. The next one did the same, so the man taking room service up actually yanked on the door to get it to close! My heart skipped a beat watching him do that. The third elevator had yellow tape across it, "out of order." We used the stairs the rest of the time even with our luggage headed to the taxi to go to the cruise ship. Our room was really worn down. I imagine since they are remodeling the lobby (it was gorgeous) the rooms will follow next. For a one night stay, it was fine. Just nothing to say "wow" I'm starting my vacation well. Yes, it was a 28.00 plus tip taxi ride from the airport. This will be the perfect place to stay once they get the remodeling done and the elevators fixed. You can just tell the place is older.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a look at Miami”
Reviews.Author: Georgina T
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in a harbour cruise, shopping and some good dining this hotel is for you. It is located just across the street from the Harbour Marketplace. Be aware if you wish to park in their lot get there early by 11 a.m. to get a spot. This lot is micro sized and when we arrived at a quarter to 11 in the a.m. there were only 2 spots left. The lot holds abhout 40 cars.

Reviews.Title: “great location for pre/post cruise”
Reviews.Author: averygrace
Reviews.Content: stayed one night pre cruise. the location is fantastic, right across from the bayside shopping and marina. Staff were very nice and it was a quick cab ride to the ship. The room was very clean and I found out after that they do have a washer and dryer, as we were doing 2 cruises and was looking to do laundry in between, unfortunatly I could not get a room the following week

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Odarci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in January/2012 before a cruise. Our request for a room on a high floor with a view of the port was granted. The hotel room itself is quite large, 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa plus a microwave, fridge and TV. We were on the 7th floor and had an amazing view of the ships in port. We had a very good night sleep as the hotel was very quiet. The location is good as it is across the street from the Bayside Marketplace, two blocks from the American Airlines Arena and 1 block from the metromover station. There is a CVS two blocks away. The check-in and check-out was fast. The hotel should improve the elevators system as well as provide more space at its parking lot. All in all, this property was a good option for us at a reasonable price (for downtown Miami standards). I would recommend it for pre-cruise stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishimp17
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something close to the port, and walking distance to restaurants and shops, this is a super location. Otherwise, the experience was less than impressive. The lobby was undergoing construction, three of us were attempting to bring luggage in and the 'bellman' was nowhere to be found (I believe he was on a smoke break). Service in the restaurant was below average, and every time I refilled my coffee myself, I was glared at (as opposed to waiting for service?) HOWEVER -- location and price were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: wjtlpn
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our one night stay here prior to a cruise. Rooms were very clean, excellent location as it is across the street from the Bayside Marketplace! Elevators were a bit of a pain. At least one was out at all times. Used the service elevator a lot. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BrazilMarcio
Reviews.Content: excellent location, cleaness can improve and limited spots to park the car.Current facelift.A bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise”
Reviews.Author: durham9185
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here before a cruise, the first time a year ago. This year the hotel has undergone tremendous renovations in the lobby area and restaurant. Absolutely stunning. The rooms are scheduled for renovation next. However, our room was great, even before renovations. Very comfortable and very clean. Once again, wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Morrly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on January 14, 2012 and was very pleased with our stay, the staff was very friendly, the room was clean, would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful yet again!”
Reviews.Author: gymstx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last January and again this January before going on our cruise. Once again we had a wonderful time. The hotel was undergoing some renovations and yes, the place could use some. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help us in any way they could. I love the location of this hotel being across from The Bayside Market. We ate at Chili's once again and loved it. The hotel room itself is quite large, 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. We were on the 7th floor and had an amazing view of the ships in port. We had a very good night sleep as the hotel was very quiet. We will stay here again if we cruise out of Miami in the future!

Reviews.Title: “great staff terrible accommodation”
Reviews.Author: maltoronto
Reviews.Content: Do not recommend this hotel until it is fully renovated unless you get a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty rundown”
Reviews.Author: Tundrachoochoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty to say the least. Only the bed felt like a safe haven of cleanliness. Won't tell details... The staff was nice, but it couldn't make the room feel good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect before cruise”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here because of how close it is to the cruise port, the taxi ride over there was only about 5 minutes or so. The hotel is nothing fancy, but it provided a nice clean room and comfortable beds which is all we really needed. The Bayside Market across the street was a HUGE bonus. There was tons of shopping and places to eat including Bubba Gumps. Even though the hotel is located downtown and across the street from the market, it was very quiet. If we sail out of Miami again we'd stay here, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A good time”
Reviews.Author: anniemayence
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights. We have been lucky enough to have a room on the top floor with a wonderful view on the bay. The lobby was under renovation. The restaurant offers good food for a reasonable price. The hotel is located steps from Bayside and the American Airlines Arena. It's easy to drive to Miami Beach. We had no problem with the parking. We recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent!”
Reviews.Author: dmrobertson
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, there was 5 of us staying in the room and it was a perfect size for us on the 8th floor with an amazing view of the marina. There was two downsides to the hotel; they are currently renovating so there was works constantly going on and the pool was closed which was a big downside to the kids. The 2nd thing being we asked the concierge what there was to do, he suggested we go to Macy's, who honestly comes to Miami to check out Macy's. Otherwise quite happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Start of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nitin S
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. The hotel lobby was going through much needed renovations but the rooms were very outdated and the bathroom tub had water draining issues.

Reviews.Title: “Just wait till the construction is finished! This place will be beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TXDaycationer
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was closest to the port and my husband and I were going to go on our first cruise. I read all of the reviews and knew about the construction. Most of them are true. There is a lot of construction going on, but when they finish, WOW! Marble floors, marble desks, they will have an extremely nice lobby. The rooms are very nice but they seem a bit outdated. The contractors made several errors in our bathroom - which were apparent even to my untrained eye. Nice accomodations in a great location. We went exploring before our cruise. Miami itself is a typical city but seems to have issues with their sewers not functioning properly as we picked up on sewer smell in our walks around the neighborhood. One thing......parking. I tried to read on here and get comfortable that our vehicle would be OK - both on our stay here and where to park for our cruise. I read on one internet site that you could leave your vehicle in this parking lot. THIS IS NOT TRUE AND YOU WILL BE TOWED! There is very limited space for parking in this hotel's lot. There is a guard all through the night so your vehicle should be safe. For cruise parking, park at the port. The $20 per day is worth every penny for onsite parking at the port. We would stay here again when we go on our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are looking for a pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDG5400
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, 12/23/11, before a cruise. Great location. Renovations were in full swing which made the lobby somewhat chaotic, but we were given a discount card for $5 off each meal in the dining room. Chaotic lobby was really not a big deal as we had no intention of hanging out in the lobby anyway. We requested an early check-in and a room on a high floor with a view of the port. Both requests were granted and it was particularly fun to see the cruise ships in port. The room itself was fairly basic, but clean and spacious enough. We were able to walk across the street to Bayside Marketplace and grab some dinner and take in some live entertainment. There is a CVS a block away which was perfect for replacing the sunscreen that security confiscated from our carry-on bag at the airport. (It was my partner's brilliant idea--not mine--to pack our sunscreen in the carry-on!) I kept getting kicked off of the free Wifi about every 15 mins. After several times of logging in to only get booted a few mins later, I remembered I was supposed to be on vacation. I took it as a sign to log the hell out and relax. Great decision. We ate breakfast in the dining room and it was a fairly good breakfast. We intentionally went downstairs with all of our luggage, ahead of the rush, as we had heard that things get really hectic around 10:00 - 11:00 AM - crowded elevators, pushing, shoving, gnashing of teeth, shedding of blood and the occasional beheading. We wished to avoid all that. All in all, this property was a good option for us at a reasonable price. I definitely would recommend it for pre-cruise stays.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lovethesunnl
Reviews.Content: My mom, daughter and I stayed at this hotel in late March 2011 prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel's proximity to the port was the main reason I selected this hotel. Renovations were just beginning when we stayed there, and the rooms were certainly due for a refresh. Our room overlooking the harbor providing an excellent view and the hotel is within walking distance of several malls. The Bayside Market across the street is an excellent place to shop, eat (Chili's and Hard Rock Cafe were both excellent) or just stroll and enjoy the scenery. Overall, the staff was OK, but didn't go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I may stay at this hotel again, simply due to its location and reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not too hot...”
Reviews.Author: JasmineLilypad
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn I will grant you, was in the process of being refurbished when we stayed. I can roll with that. I am unsure which parts are being redone - but I hope it's the whole thing eventually!! The rooms were small and had one extra chair that kinds made it difficult to walk around. The carpet I am sure was clean, but I rather kept my slippers on. Bathroom was nice and clean -albeit small. You could tell the hotel was very old from the mortar-work and the paint - a few spruce-ups to that and it would be just fine. Perhaps it is just aesthetics, but it does make a world of difference. But the beds were very neat and comfortable, the coffeemaker worked, the tv was fine and there was hot water. The closet was large and we are always happy for an in-room safe. There is a sweet small Italian restaurant downstairs Marina Bistro Cafe. Nice for breakfast and ravioli. The location cannot be beat! The Bayside Marketplace is less than two minutes walking and filled with places to eat (a food court and restaurants: http://www.baysidemarketplace.com/), have a drink in the evening and live entertainment at night. Lots of shopping - Express, Victoria's Secret (is there still a secret?), Guess?, GNC, f.y.e, etc. Right behind you is Flagler Street and Downtown Miami. A good healthy walk to a small Macy's, Marshalls and so on. It's downtown Miami. I was thrilled for the CVS a block away and even the Walgreens around the corner. If you want to go anywhere - besides taxis and buses - there is the Metro within walking distance. Good stuff. Sour-ish Points: 1. Internet was s.l.o.w. I could Pony-Express faster. 2. The pool wasn't terribly inviting 3. Parking - we rented a car and for two nights we had to basically beg to park - not because there was no parking - but because the parking attendant for the hotel seemed to be asleep most of the time. 4. No fridge. No microwave. All round, this was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Their chance being too close from the cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: Cristian C
Reviews.Content: Renovations, inside of the hotel everything look old- carpet, walls, main restaurant so and so. The only advantage wa sbeing very close from the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jacqvan
Reviews.Content: Whereas there were works in the lobby we add a great stay, The reception was very helpful. Nice location in front of the Port of Miami, free wifi, nice breakfast not so expensive. Good value for money! The swimming pool is not very welcoming; and the internet access in the business corner was soooooo slow, but free with printers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Badbaxandwife
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for pre-cruise stay. It is across the street from an outdoor mall and Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant which was fun. The hotel lobby has some construction but does not interfere too much. The hotel is older but very clean and comfortable for spending one night. I thought it is a little bit expensive but you are paying for location. Also a CVS drug store only one block away is perfect for the last minute things to pick up before cruising (like cases of pop and water) hotel pool does not look like the advertised pictures...........and is NOT heated.

Reviews.Title: “close to the cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: townby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for being close to the cruise terminal and the Bayside Mall area. Currently the front lobby was under construction but it was not really an issue. The breakfast/bar area was remodelled and nice. Service there was lacking a little but it was OK. The rooms were older but still nice. Beds were comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: AggieDiver86
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami prior to a Carnival cruise. Front Desk Service and check-in process was excellent. We had a lot of luggage and it was all briskly loaded up for us when we arrived and departed. The hotel is very close to the cruise ship terminals and we could see the ships from our room windows. Was very easy and inexpensive to get a cab to the cruise ship terminal. The hotel is directly across the street from the Bayside Marketplace which is full of shops, entertainment venues, and several good restaurants. There are several pharmacies and stores if you need to do any last minute shopping along Biscayne Blvd, all within 10 minute walk of the hotel. Our room was OK, clean, nothing great, and a little outdated. Hotel could definitely use a renovation, and may be doing so. While we were there, the first floor lobby was under renovation - but not certain if project was extending to the rooms. There was no construction noise at night. If you need a hotel prior to or after a cruise, this Holiday Inn is a good choice at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Completely dissapointed at the Holiday Inn....”
Reviews.Author: alecheverry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business as there were no more room at the Intercontinental and this hotel was 4-5 blocks away. The hotel is undergoing construction and hopefully gets ready soon. The hotel is very well located, in front of an outdoor mall where you can do a lot of shopping and find plenty of restaurants (hard rock cafe, cuban, steakhouse etc). If you drive be ready to pay $13 a night for your car....and arrive early as there's only space for about 40 cars in the lot, which, by the way, closes at midnight (so if you don't arrive by that time good luck trying to park). The rooms were clean, neat, just your standard room as any hotel.... However, the quality of sleep was terrible: The windows are not soundproof and the walls and doors are so thin that you can hear everyone walking by at night....One of the nights this was horrible as three persons arrived late (2 AM) and woke all the floor because of their talk on the hallway while they were trying to open the door (I saw 3 other persons with their doors open trying to get these guys to shup up - horrible). The wireless internet in the room didn't work at all and it was S.L.O.W ---------- aweful since I actually had to work. I went to the business center and it was worst: The system log me on and it started a timer (20 minutes / person) but it took me 18 minutes to log into my email account (that's how fast it was)...by the time I was starting to check my first mail the system log me out and I was so upset that left the business center immediately....So business center: 0 stars. On Sunday night around 8 pm, while I was at the bar, the power went off in this hotel: the rest of the block had light and power but something failed here (maybe because of the renovation/construction?) and we were without power for almost 1.5 hours. Since the staff didn't know what was going on and kept repeating that the power was going to be back pretty soon, and I had to work on presentations but couldn't because there wasn't any power or internet, I decided to check out and move to the Hilton which had rooms available (by the way, rooms here at the Holiday Inn were $190/night and only $159 at the Hilton; so think about that when booking).......But before I was able to do that, I had to go to the CVS two blocks away, get a flashlight, and go to the 6th floor to start packing.....and oh boy, I was scared now for my safety as none of the EXIT signs or emergency lights was working at all...the halls were in complete darkness. The other travelers thought I was with the hotel because of the flashlight and I had to help some people to get into their rooms during this time. After I packed and carried my bag 6 floors down I check out and got out of there ASAP.....(By this time, it has been 2 hours without any power and was very concerned that some of the folks there were going to be there in complete darkness for the whole night). The staff was very worried about the travelers during this situation but they were really unprepared for it....safety was a concern for me and at least this nothing but a power outage...but what if there is a fire in the middle of the night? Will the signs and exit stairs light work then? I'm completely dissapointed and will never stay at this hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “It may get better ...”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, and is in the heart of the city, near the downtown area and across the street from the park and beach shops. We arrived after midnight, and had consistently called to alert the front desk to our late arrival - no one answered. When we arrived, the desk clerk explained that he was all alone and doing paper work. The hotel sits on the street with no place to stop and unload, although, during the day, some folks do stop there. The parking area in the rear was not manned, though fenced. I had to find a place to park, walk back to the hotel, and make arrangements to securely park my car. The room was clean. But the hotel, is in terrible shape. It is being renovate, and when that is finished - who knows. It is still overpriced for its condition. Frankly, it is not worthy of the Holiday Inn label, though all of us know, sadly, that trusted label has been in decline. Access is through the pool area to the front desk during renovation. So sorry to have to provide this 'bad experience' report.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: trekasue
Reviews.Content: Just across the street is a nice outdoor mall with places to eat and on the water. Nice place before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Only for cruises”
Reviews.Author: slappythesecond
Reviews.Content: There is only one real reason to stay here, waiting for your ship to come in. We always use this hotel the day before we cruise. We have stayed there 3-4 times and never had a problem of any type. Rooms okay, breakfast is okay, pool is okay but, walk across the street and you are ready to start relaxing for the cruise. Being at the Market place is always the "warm up" to our cruise. A very short taxi ride and you are at the ships.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work...”
Reviews.Author: Licha_on_the_go
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel I read the mixed reviews and went ahead and made my reservation anyways based on their location. It is right across from Bayside Marketplace where there is shopping, food, and entertainment. Only a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport($25) and an even shorter trip across the bridge to the port terminal($10). As far as the location, it was perfect for our pre and post cruise stay. The accommodations need some work though... On our pre cruise stay, the window valance was taped to the wall with masking tape and the bed was average comfort. On our post cruise stay, the walls were dirty, curtain had a huge rip in it as well as one of the wash cloths. We had a very loud group staying in a few rooms next to us and we could hear everything. It was so bad that we had to go out and tell them to be quiet. I know that is not the hotel's fault, but the walls are thin and the sound travels easily. If we come back to this area for another cruise I will most likely be looking for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated”
Reviews.Author: mitchtolcon
Reviews.Content: As a family we booked a nights stay at this hotel whilst waiting to board a cruise. Although the rooms are quite cheap you still expect the basics. Air con is freezing and cannot be changed to be any warmer. This review barely got published as the Wifi the hotel offers is slower than dial up. The staff messed up our room bookings, we asked for two rooms both with two single beds and either through a misunderstanding or something being lost in translation (english has to be some of their second language) we got given two rooms with double beds and then got blamed for the error. The location is nice, the market place over the road is pleasant. The Gym looks like it hasnt been updated in 30 years... A lot of things about this hotel frustrate me and i am usually the easiest of going travellers, give me a bed and the basics and ill be happy, however not in this case. Even the bell sound at every level in the elevator annoys me. I wouldnt recommend this hotel for more than a night or if there are any other options available...

Reviews.Title: “Post-cruise stay & worthwhile !”
Reviews.Author: Fernfield
Reviews.Content: We booked a king suite here for one night following our disembarkation from Queen Victoria in Fort Lauderdale and although we were a little doubtful about the area around the hotel we were more than pleased. Our room was lovely, very large sitting room with a small kitchenette for making tea, coffee etc., exceptionally clean with (what appeared to be) almost new fitted carpet and comfortable large sofa and two armchairs, coffee table, lamps and enormous flat-screen tv. We had no problem at all controlling the air-con, just turned it up or down on the switch on the wall. The bedroom was reached through double doors, again, very clean with an extremely comfortable king-size bed, choice of pillows (soft, firm etc.), another large flat-screen tv, dressing table with large mirror and bright lamp, bedside tables with lamps, clock etc., and plenty of wardrobe space. The bathroom led out of the bedroom. We couldn't fault anything at all. There were no tea bags or spoon when we arrived, just a choice of coffees, but housekeeping soon fixed us up with teabags, spoon, and a carton of fresh milk. We found the reception staff to be very courteous, friendly and helpful and we ate at the restaurant on the night of our arrival and found the staff very attentive, polite and the choice of food very good and generous. It is in an excellent position right opposite the Bayside Market with a plethora of shops to suit every taste, dozens of restaurants and bars catering for all, from seafood (try Bubba Gumps), oyster bars, Italian bistros, Chinese restaurants and many, many more, right on the waterfront of the pretty and bustling marina. We took a boat trip for an hour and a half the first day and on the second day bought tickets for the open-topped tour bus, a hop on hop off ticket, and went on both the city tour and south beach tour. Both were excellent value and very informative. All in all, do not hesitate to try this hotel for value for money in a central position. Yes, there is renovation work inside the hotel foyer but this did not interfere in any way with the enjoyment of our stay, and the concierge went out of his way to explain the various tours available, booked our airport cab, and held our bags until we departed. We consider the hotel to offer excellent value for money and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: Room was fine. Hotel was being renovated. Air conditioning system was FREEZING and we had to have a maintenance person come to adjust it. Now, I think I'm a reasonable intelligent person, but I could not figure out how to adjust the system where it would stay adjusted. The restaurant had decent food, but the service was super slow. I had to ask for my credit card and bill back after waiting for an unacceptably long time. We at at the Bubba Gumps after the first experience at the hotel restaurant (across the street at the Bayside marketplace). I was surprised that they didn't offer shuttle service from the airport or to the Port. Overall - quite average.

Reviews.Title: “Renovating but worth the experience”
Reviews.Author: wayners_11
Reviews.Content: They are remodeling so the main NON wheelchair accessible entrance 2 large steps, there is a temporary entrance on the side (2nd st) but in locked and you have to have someone ask for them to open. Great access to Bayside Marketplace where great shops and restraunts. great walking areas, AA arena and Miami port where huge cruise ships dock and. hotel is nice we did get a free coupon for free bufet breakfast, *********must complain******

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by a hotel that could be great.”
Reviews.Author: GrahamB67
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller for 20 years, and a weekly visitor to InterContinental/Holiday Inn properties, this 3 night stay was disappointing. It was totally salvagable, but the staff were not interested in my (or other guests) comments. My air conditioning stopped working on the first day, but "could not be fixed for a week" and there was no alternative room. My room had a connecting door with very little sound insulation, and I know a great deal about my neighbour's 2012 business plan now from late night/early morning phone calls while he paced around the room the other side of the door. Ice machine noise at night in the corridor is random and always just at the time I was falling asleep. There was building work going on - I'm not complaining directly about this, as the end result will be worth it. However the 3 lifts were restricted to one during building works (10 floors - 20 rooms per floor - max 10 people per lift!). I tried to walk and used the stairs, but the fire doors were locked!! Staff said it stopped intruders. Totally unacceptable. The building works continued throughout mealtimes, with no respite to the drilling. The free High Speed Internet was pointless, as it was slower than 1995's dial-up - I once managed a download speed of 0.3mbsbs (normally less than 0.1mbs). Bizarrely, uploads could run at 0.4mbs. 15% gratuity is included on breakfast and dinner bills yet staff still asked for a separate tip (breakfast was a self-service buffet!) Reception couldn't consider a late check out until day of check out (after 11:00), and then no later than 12:30. I had hoped for mid/late afternoon, but this is impossible. For a night flight home, this is of little use. Location and room size gives the potential for this to be an excellent hotel. It is just sad that the staff don't want to help guests.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights ... The night before our cruise and when we returned!!”
Reviews.Author: MsFabulous78
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel it your going on a cruise in the morning....This hotel is very close to the port and our view from the window was Fabulous. We could see the cruise ships and that was very exciting. There's the Bayside Mall across the street so we spent alot of time there. For dinner we ate at Bubba Gump Shrimp... YUMMY!! The hotel was very quiet and the staff was very friendly!! Had breakfast in the morning a little pricey but very good and worth it. Took a cab to the pier its way cheaper to take a cab than the shuttle. The hotel was clean and that will definitely be my hotel for when Im cruising!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: jkpemay
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my girlfriends pre cruise. Very convenient location less than 5 minutes from the pier across the street from the Bayside Mall. Other than that not too much around. Took a cab to Miami Beach around 15 minutes $25.00 for 4 of us. We had 2 rooms. My friends room was much nicer than ours. They had a great view and a larger room. Ours was towards the back and tiny. You practically walked into the bed when you came into the room. Closet on the right - pretty good size. Bathroom next to that -very tiny. This is not a typical size hotel room at all. Also we had a view of the rooftops. I was a bit concerned by the flyers under the door and the flimsy door. Furnishings were sparse and on the cheap side. Old gigantic TV. Rooms definitely need an update. My overall impression was of a somewhat seedy motel. Seemed clean enough though. The hotel is under construction. Staff was nice. It was OK for one night but I wouldn't have wanted to stay longer than that. I may have liked the hotel better if I had my friends room!

Reviews.Title: “gets old fast”
Reviews.Author: abbey101
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a mess r now and was last year when i was there at the same time. they are working on construction. parking is awful and they tell you if our lot is full just find somewhere else and we will take it off your bill. they try and pack in way to many cars and you seriously may not be able to open your car door to get in. i had to go throught the passenger door it was so crowded. they do have a security guard 24/7 tho. room service food was good. the breakfast was blaaa. runny eggs and fake greasy bacon. the hostess lady in the morning is extremely rude every day, the bartender as well!!! i guess maybe because i dont speak spanish?? i have stayed here for 3 weeks in the past 2 years. the bay across the street was cool for the first week but got old fast. dont go behind the hotel especially at night!!!! short stay is ok. but i wouldnt stay long term. there was one extremely cool guy there that said he was just hired, he was a waiter, name was giovanni i think?? knows the area very well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Yes,Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Vera-Veronque
Reviews.Content: Construction, Faulty elevators (Lady with the walky talkie was searching for a trapped guest), LOCKED staircase, Uncaring nightlady, Party at my pillow (paper thin walls?) For safety reasons this hotel won't be my pick ever. What kind of hotel locks their staircase...and then takes 10 minutes to find their key for it? Yikes, An accident waiting to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location for port and Bayside”
Reviews.Author: stokie_gem
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few nights after arriving back from a cruise. The hotel is a great location for the port and for the Bayside complex which you can walk to in about 3 minutes. The views from the hotel rooms were also lovely, looking out over the city and the port. The room itself was spacious enough, lifts got to all floors, free use of business centre with free computers and internet access, free wifi. We had some trouble with the amount of breakfasts our reservation included as we booked with a third party who had not specified correctly but the manager offered us all complimentary breakfasts as courtesy. The breakfast was buffet with plenty of choice. Staff were friendly, there was a car park but this was $12 per night I think. Nice size swimming pool at rear of hotel also with sunbathing area and sunbeds.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dkoenemann
Reviews.Content: The place was a mess (under construction but I don't think you can blame it all on that) but the unforgivable part was the arrogant rudeness of about 50% of the staff, especially in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: nyknickfan1
Reviews.Content: Everyone here is really nice, and they keep the property very clean. However there are two really big problems. One is that if you go out at night, chances are the parking lot will be full when you return, and you will have to go to an off premise lot and pay to park your car. Second is, the televisions. They are the old analog types. I've stayed here countless times, and never have I stayed when the remote was working properly and at least one of the TV channels is not frozen. And it always seemed to be one of the channels I wanted to watch. I have been staying here for years, simply for the sheer convenience of the location, but I stopped because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was friendly; hotel needs the renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Mooneyson1
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights since my son ran an Ironman. The staff was very helpful but some spoke poor English. Excellent location especially for cruisers. The fold up bed was terrible so we put the mattress on the floor. Also, the AC was very difficult to operate - had to call for help. The computer in the business center was so bad I had to use the computer at the front desk. They need to spend a hundred bucks to improve their computers. Breakfast was good - fair value. We were lucky and got a great view of the Bay. All in all, I'd stay here again despite my gripes. Again, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: daylight110
Reviews.Content: Good location across from Bayside Marketplace (shopping and dining). Room was very clean with a view of the port of miami. Staff was very helpful setting up our taxi for 4 am departure. Ask staff at checkin for a higher floor room with a view of the port, our wish was granted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Millyj
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel ONLY because of the location. We actually stayed there September the 16th 2011. I booked in advanced on a friends and family rate about $108.00 for our night there. The location is EXCELLENT, right across the street from Bay Street and you can actually catch the C or the S bus to South Beach which we did. The bus stop is right across the street from the hotel and it drops you off right in the front. The only thing was that I called the hotel and emailed them well in advance of our flight coming in VERY early so we had to wait 4 hours before we got a room. We ate breakfast at the onsite restaurant and we had to wait in the lobby for 3 hours, HOWEVER the desk clerk (I forget her name) was gracious enough to come over to us and give us a room with a great view and coupons for the restaurant for waiting so long. They were doing construction when we were there so the lobby area was full of noise. HOWEVER, we cruise next year from the same port and because of the location I will be using this hotel again. Not bad.

Reviews.Title: “September Break”
Reviews.Author: mquinn16
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is centrally located across the street from Bayside Shopping and restaurant areas. Hotel staff are friendly and willing to help. We had a room on the eighth floor with a view of the port. Very nice. The bar or restaurant is not opened during the day, so we walked to CVS and stocked up on water and snacks. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loud and noisy but good location.”
Reviews.Author: abrunette70
Reviews.Content: Very loud and noisy. They give you a paper when you check in that quiet time starts at 11pm so donâ€™t plan on taking a nap or anything during the day. This is not a place to stay for relaxing but more for convenience for the location. I did complain because the girls next door had music blaring and were screaming, laughing and banging and I was told by the front desk its only 4:00 p.m. and my response was this will continue well into the night. Sure enough it did at 1:30 a.m. and we had to call security; by then the front desk had called the room and they were quiet by the time the security got there. We didnâ€™t hear anything else but for $170 a night who wants to get up, put on their clothes and walk down to the front desk to complain. It was 30 min from the phone call to when we had to go get security. The front desk seemed bothered by it. The room was clean and good location but overpriced. $170 per night check in at 3 and check out at 11 isnâ€™t even 24 hours and no microwave or refrigerator. I wouldnâ€™t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction...”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under renovation and parking is no gaurantee. Staff was very helpful. They originally assigned us a room at the rear of the hotel, but they worked hard to get us moved to the front side of the hotel after we told them we could not sleep listening to the hotel air conditioner. Strongly recommend that frontside of the hotel is requested for a room. Bayside marketplace is across the street with many shops and restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba Gump's, Hooters, etc.). Downtown is walking distance. South Beach is a 5 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location for Bayside marketplace and port”
Reviews.Author: mysteryreview
Reviews.Content: Stayed night before going to airport. Convenient location to walk across to Bayside market place. there are restaurants and boat tours there. many people stay here to take cruises. The room was clean and comfortable. There is limited parking with a security guard and it is gated at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and Post cruise”
Reviews.Author: Baldipaul
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, well located for exploring Miami post cruise. Staff were very helpful and the concierge found us a fixed price taxi to take us to the airport at the end of our holiday which was $15 cheaper than the taxi from the airport to the hotel. The Bayside market opposite was also excellent with a good choice of restaurants, bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sdcruisingmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before a cruise leaving Oct 1st and was very happy with the stay. Yes, the hotel is a bit older (they are currently renovating to upgrade things) but the room was clean, service was great and the breakfast was very good. I agree with other reviewers - make sure you tell them you are a priority club member and you get a discount! The rate was great value too! We had an awesome view of the waterfront from the 9th floor, and had quite a spectacular lightening show to boot! Location is fabulous with Bayside across the street. Leisurely morning on cruise day, then off to the port. They had people hailing cabs and helping with luggage. We saw this hotel when we were in Miami 2 cruises ago and really wanted to try it because of it's great location. We were not disappointed and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Harpo22
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to spend a weekend in Miami prior to going on a cruise. We looked at some reviews on Trip Advisor and they were mostly positive. Our experience was that it was ideal for our needs and the room rates were good. it is in an ideal position for exploring Miami - there is a bus stop directly opposite, as is the Bayside Mall. Miami South Beach area was great. It surprised me that the majority language spoken by the hotel staff was spanish .......... hotel staff were polite nad helpful ..... rooms were clean and spacious ............. surrounding downtown area is not so good .............. we ate at Bubba Gumps in Bayside and it was good fun but pricey ................ all in all I would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “It's the closest to the Port of Miami AND the Bayside Marketplace...”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_Houston
Reviews.Content: Which are the two positive points about this hotel. It's not the newest. It's not the most updated boutique hotel. BUT it is a good value for your money and the staff are empowered to make sure your stay is a pleasant experience. There IS a very small parking lot BEHIND the hotel for only $12/night so come early to grab one of the spots. It would be nice if they moved the gigantic trash container so one didn't have to walk past it in order to enter the hotel's back entrance. Walk past the pool, enter the large lobby, have an apple at checkin then head towards the front door but stop in the bar and restaurant for a huge club sandwich or more fun fare. Drugstore for last minute amenities is 1.5blocks away and the Bayside Marketplace is directly across the street. I drove over to the port in the morning and parked at the Port for $20/night so I could take part in the express departure at the end of my cruise thus making my car only a few yards away from the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaK49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights before leaving on a cruise. Really enjoyed being close to Bayside Marketplace for places to eat and lots of activity. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. Great view! Pool at hotel is nice and fun view of downtown Miami. Staff is excellent! Talk to Rommel or any of the conceirge staff about the city and water tour. We did and had a WONDERFUL time!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Surilady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, opposite the bayside market, putting dining, entertainment and shopping just steps away. Also just two bloks from the shops in downtown Miami. It is a great location, everything is in walking distance, for those who do not have their own transportation. The hotel is a bit dated, but will do nicely for a short stay. I was there last in July. The hotel was quite busy as it is frequented by large groups who stay there to go to the cruise ports. Lots of tourists, and tour travellers frequent this hotel. The bayshide market provides entertainment and dining options and is safe to get to even late at night for a solo woman. Although it is not the greatest, modern looking hotel, I have stayed there 4 times before, and will probably go back, because of it's easy access to almost anywhere you would want to go. Busstop to South Beach, Aventura, just steps away. The staff is helpfull. The room was a bit musky. It can also be a bit noisy, as you can hear people slamming the doors, and talking. I will definetly stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days. We loved it. Yes there were some noises from construction, but it was livable. The location was perfect for us as my son was having surgery at Bascom Palmer. We were able to take back roads and stay off the expressway. The staff was wonderful. Noel, Diane, Sarah were great. You helped us tremendously and always with a smile. The location is right across the street from Bayside Market which gave us things to do within walking distance. Live bands, shopping, and great food just across the street what more could you ask for. We have already booked our next visit. Did I mention the view.........OMG it was beautiful, overlooking the bay. Sunrises breathtaking. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is okay for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: hmangold
Reviews.Content: This hotel was doing contruction on the main floor and did not disclose this information prior to booking the room. Our room was musky and in need of many repairs. The hotel is in a good location if you are going to the cruise ports. I was very disappointed but is good enough to stay overnight.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at this hotel but i wish I stayed more , i felt the warm welcome since I arrived by the receptionist who was as he told me that he was originally Algerian . He gave me a nice room with a view on the upper floor . and he also provide me a 5 dollars discount card that I could use for breakfast . The room was clean and big enough with large bed and coffee maker . Not to forget the nice vie of the harbor . Nice staff and excellent hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hope they finish the alterations soon!”
Reviews.Author: Drjillb
Reviews.Content: Great location but was in the middle of very noisy renovations when we stayed which meant the restaurant was impossible to eat in (although it WAS open). Room was very spacious & bed very comfortable (there were two queen beds & a sofa bed in our room) but when looking for a power socket we found piles of dust, dirt & cobwebs behind all the furniture. Has its own pool, and car parking immediately to the rear, which is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “good pre-cruise rest”
Reviews.Author: Bg M
Reviews.Content: we flew into fort lauderdale and took a shuttle to get here, arriving a little after 4 and were graciously checked in. room was clean and neat and although the elevator seemed a little slow, i have no problems with this hotel. some renovation going on for the dining room on the first floor but this did not affect us in our room on the third...we had a smoking room so we could not go any higher. nearby drug stores-cvs and walgreens- provided what we needed for our cruise which began the next day...bayside provided entertainment, shopping and dinner (bubba gumps)...mickeyd's about a block away (down the street) for a quick early breakfast before we left for the port...nice hotel, older, but convenient and staff was kind; unable to use television to check out but staff was quick and we were on our way...i will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: myblessing
Reviews.Content: Must arrived during stated arrival time. If not may be delay in check in time. Otherwise very good hotel for stay before cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abdive
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good location. The staff are attentive and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dogsmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the day before our cruise. Picked this hotel because of previous reviews and its location to the Biscayne shopping and restaurants across the street. Was able to have dinner and then make some last minute purchases at the CVS at the next corner. Caught a taxi across the street for the ride to the port. We were charged $10. The hotel itself was clean with comfortable beds, but seemed to be showing its age. Chairs and carpeting were worn. The buffet breakfast the next morning was probably better at 9 am, but we didn't get to it until 11 am, right before they closed. Pretty much dried left overs, but they had fresh coffee and we were happy they discounted $5 for Priority Club members. Over all I would consider staying here again, but would like to see some freshening up of the interior.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough!”
Reviews.Author: Maxydog
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the review associated with this hotel, both good and bad. We stayed for two nights before a cruise. The hotel is clean, close to entertainment and food and has free internet unlike most hotels. I would stay here again without any hesitation and I found that most of the bad reviews were unfounded during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohsunseeker
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for our pre-cruise stay. We requested and received a room with a bayside view. Right across the street is the bayside market which was a fabulous spot for shopping and dining. The CVS just down from the hotel was perfect for buying some supplies for our cruise. We could see the cruise ships come in and depart the port from our hotel window. The breakfast buffet was very good. The only problem we encountered was an issue with check in...otherwise, highly recommended...Oh, one other word of caution, if you are on the bay side and are an early to bed person, take ear plugs :) ...the music from the bayside market is extremely loud...the night we were there the band played until 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay at all (for one night)”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at this hotel, pre cruise, as it is really close to the Port of Miami, taxi cab to the port about 5-6 dollars plus tips, taxi from the airport should have been 24 dollars plus tips(flat rate) but it says airport to the Port of Miami not hotels, oh well, the hotel is also great if you like basketball and the Miami heat as it is next to it as well, also the Bayside Marketplace which says open till 9pm on sundays, but i noticed most restaurants stay open late, much later than 9pm, walking distance to CVS pharmacy for items forgotten, of course its a holiday inn so no free hot breakfast, which it was an express... other than that its a good hotel for pre/post cruise....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable & convenient stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BWB1021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for a one day stay prior to our cruise departure. We were greeted by all hotel personnel and our check-in was very thorough. We were provide information on hotel amenities and the area. The room was a very pleasant surprise. The size exceeded our expectations and we had a view of the port. We were on the 9th floor and could see the ships come in to dock in the morning. Bayside is across the street (easy access) with all of its shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. We enjoyed walking, shopping, & dining. The area is chock full of shopping and dining options. I would have rated hotel 5 stars, but I was not impressed with the breakfast buffet. Food was lukewarm to cold; and just didn't meet the standard for my Holiday Inn experiences. The staff was courteous in all of our encounters and we would definately book again!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise with my elderly parents and fiance. The rooms are old and worn, the service was so so. We ended up having a very very frustrating evening here due to some bad directions from the front desk, they made up for it by compting us breakfast. I ended up booking a different hotel after we got back from our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessy_Brazil
Reviews.Content: All I can say is...WOWl!!! My friend and I stayed there 1 day before the cruise and it was more than I expected! The hotel is PERFECT, the staff is really helpful and sympathetic, comfy beds, super clean rooms and the breakfast is FABULOUS!! Next year IÂ´m staying there FOR SURE!! I highly recommend Holiday Inn Port of Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the money! Best Location for the money!”
Reviews.Author: wrk2hrd
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel blindly. Didn't know the area, just knew it was near the Port of Miami. I didn't know it was DIRECTLY across the street from the Port of Miami, as well as Bayside (shops and dining).....AND across the street from the American Airlines Arena!!! So we were able to walk to dinner and then score some last second tickets to watch game 3 playoffs of the Heat vs Bulls! The room was on the 10th floor over looking it all! Was able to get a parking spot behind the hotel for $12 for the night. Never had to worry about parking again. Just walked. I think there may have been one other couple on the top floor with us, but on the opposite side. Zero hallway noise from other guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stepoff Hotel for Cruise Folk”
Reviews.Author: TravellerThirteen
Reviews.Content: Read reviews of this Hotel before our Cruise and am glad I did not listen to the whiney reviews. This Hotel had everything you needed for an overnight stay. Staff were very helpful, hardworking and accomodating the folks arriving or departing for Cruise destinations. Desk staff were fast and friendly. Room staff were wonderful. Breakfast staff got us in and out very quickly or you could just linger if you wished (we were not in a rush). They held our luggage for us untill we were ready to leave for the Ship and then got us a taxi. One of the best things, was the open Market across the street with great restaurants, shops and music. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dancingprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after getting off a carribean cruise. THe location is great - overlooking the cruise terminal and the bayside marketplace was fantastic for shopping and eating. THe hotel was busy and the lobby/check in area very small. The held our bags whilst we were picked up from the hotel for a city tour which was great. We got back about 5 pm and got a room on the 7th floor overlooking bayside. The room was clean and nice and beds were very comfy. We utlised the free internet and the laundry whilst there which was very handy. We felt safe in the hotel and the floor we were on was quiet. For the price we paid we were very happy with this hotel and would stay there again if going on a cruise from Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, however there is a Butâ€¦.”
Reviews.Author: Nijh
Reviews.Content: The location/price ratio for this hotel simply cannot be beaten. Across the road form Bayside, short taxi to/from PoM and a 20 minute metro/bus ride to South Beach (the Metro mover is half a block behind the hotel). Rooms were clean and of a good size, and I found the bed really comfortable with a choice of firm or soft pillows. The bathroom was a good size with really nice toiletries provided. People have commented that the rooms look old â€“ donâ€™t read this as shabby, itâ€™s just that there is a lot of dark wood furniture in there whereas â€˜modernâ€™ hotels are more â€˜Ikeaâ€™ if you know what I mean. Our rooms were on the 9th floor overlooking the port â€“ excellent, just what we wanted. We stayed 2 nights post cruise and the lobby is a constant flow of people checking in and out so allow for that when you need the elevator; the concierges will store your luggage before and after check in/out. Breakfast was really good â€“ both for quality and value, it wasnâ€™t worth going out to find somewhere. They even provided take away coffee cups so you could take some coffee away if you wished. They obviously prefer you to take the buffet - be prepared for a longish wait if you order a la carte (unless you're just after toast and coffee). Hereâ€™s the But. A few people have mentioned security here, and we did experience an issue. Something did go missing but did turn up again after it was reported. Now, it could be that we overlooked the item when we were searching for it, but we looked everywhere many times and were absolutely convinced that the item was not in our possession before we reported it. A lot of menus for pizza delivery get pushed under doors, so you get the impression that people can wander around the floors freely â€“ and maybe nip into a room when the maid isnâ€™t looking? You need card keys to get into the public toilets â€“ why not to operate the lift? So be extra careful with valuables, make double sure that you put everything in the in-room safe before you go out. It is worth the extra vigilance as it would be a shame not to stay here â€“ the location is just perfect and the staff are friendly and helpful. Overall a nice place, an oasis of value in the midst of the $$$$ hotels, tighten up on security and it would be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise location and much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: BobtheBrit
Reviews.Content: Not for the first time, I approached this hotel with some trepidation after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. I had read reports of filthy rooms, bedbug infestations, intruders in rooms, and so on. It must be said that there was little evidence of the reported airport shuttle bus, but thirty dollars got two adults and three large cases to the Holiday Inn by taxi. Once again, after my earlier concerns I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Our room on the 9th floor had clearly been recently refurbished, was clean, well appointed and had a great view of bayside market, the port and cruise ships beyond. The ninth floor was quiet and we had no trouble sleeping in the large, comfortable bed. Next morning, like most people who are about to join a cruise ship, we did some last-minute shopping at the nearby CVS drugstore and enjoyed an excellent (and inexpensive -$11.95) breakfast in the hotel. I don't normally eat breakfasts in hotels, but at that price I figured it simply wasn't worth going outside. All in all I consider this to be one of the better Holiday Inns I have stayed in, most tend to aspire to mediocrity, but perhaps this is an indication that they're getting their act together. For a night or two before a cruise this hotel has to be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jdoggcruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights before our cruise the first of April. We have an bayview room with 2 queens and a sleeper sofa. It was convienient to Bayside Marketplace and the port. We felt safe the entire time of our visit. Coming back next April!

Reviews.Title: “I expexted more for the price i paid!”
Reviews.Author: Suntara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a Caribean cruise and i expected this 4 star hotel to be at least of the same quality as my cabin onboard but it was not! Our suite room(#311) was nice but not clean, housekeeing did not empty the ashtray, did not replaced the coffee or tea or coffee cream, laundry was washed but NOT clean(yet it still took 2 whole days to recieve my laundry back!)...one day i had to wait for one whole hour to get coffeecream after calling the reception(they gave me a free continental breakfast the next day as compensation, so they knewed this was not normal!) The only good thing of this hotel is the location rigt across the street of Bayside Marketplace with lots of shops and good restaurants, very close too to the hop on/hop off Miami sightseeing busstop which i do recommend to see all the interesting sights of Miami! Will i stay again is this hotel?...Yes....but NOT at the price i payed now...218,-UDS a night without breakfast!! I think we deserved a better service for this amount isn't it? Mr.Hendrickx/Belgium. 3 nights from 20-23 March 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed BedBugs”
Reviews.Author: RickinVA
Reviews.Content: As a long time Holiday Inn Priority Club member I hate to report the bad news of this hotel. Stayed on the 10th floor, the top floor and have to report a BEDBUG infestation in my room. Found them about 3AM and checked out of the hotel a couple hours later. Hopefully I took enough precautions to prevent them from hitching a ride home in my luggage. I saw one on the desk the first day bug did not recognize it. Second night, pulled back the sheets and there were several in the bed. Reported it to the hotel as I checked out. They apologized and refunded the parking, but the $151 per night for two nights stayed on the bill. Oh well. No complaints about anything else, but nothing else really matters when your hotel has a bedbug problem. Looking to stay now at Hiltons/Hampton Inns from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Ultra29
Reviews.Content: This was our second year staying at the Holiday Inn to attend an event near the hotel. The event was in walking distance, the room was clean and across from Bayside Marketplace. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only addition I would make is to add a shuttle bus. Thank you for your excellent service and see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Port of Miami have a good location in downtown of Miami. As tourist, you would perhaps prefer to stay at South Beach, but this location is the best for the downtown hotels next to the port and Bayside Markets with shops and restaurants, as well as close to all major office and buildings in downtown of Miami. Rooms was fresh and up-to-date with comfortable beds and linen. There is space for improvements with the maintenance of the wardrobe (a mess of cables in there), but nothing that brooding. At all floors there are ice and wending machines and breakfast was very popular and a little bit of waiting time so we decided to have breakfast at McDonalds around the corner. The front desk and bell stand gaves a confused impression, but wasn't in the reality. We visit the hotel during the spring break period so it was crowdy and sometimes lively in the corridors that affected our sleep, but nothing really that the hotel could make so much more to prevent than they did. I would stay here again for a night or two!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: zvibi
Reviews.Content: As opposed to the Royal Palm where we spent 4 nights prior to our cruise, this hotel was very clean and the room was in good shape. Good location opposite Bayside Marketplace. Great service at reception desk, and they stored our luggage from check-out until our departure in the afternoon. We also had a nice dinner at the restaurant. The only drawback was some noise from a large fan on the roof of a building below our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: tigger32
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for 2 nights before getting on a cruise ship for christmas. The hotel is opposite the bayside market including The Hard Rock and other restaurants and shops and 1 block down is a CVS Pharmacy and McDonalds is behind the hotel. The room was large with lots of closet space but the bathroom door would not shut and I was sharing with my teenage son and his step dad to be (got married on the ship) a little privacy would have been good for all of us but they couldn't fix it as the door had warped. We had a 6ft bed and my son a double sofa bed - all were very comfortable and it had a coffee machine with starbucks coffee. We had the buffet breakfast but if you wanted anything off the menu, which my husband did, they ignored you and it was far too much trouble to have to get something for you, even though a room of 25 tables had 6 staff on. Security had to tell the limo outside having its own disco to turn the music off at 4am. Overall it was a great location and comfortable, we felt safe, temperature was good and it was clean. The only real issue was the length of time to get a lift with cases in a morning - be prepared to get them down early to avoid a 30 minute wait at the lift doors. We would stay here again for comfort and the location even though the service isn't fantastic but the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that is about it.”
Reviews.Author: Eckes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before our cruise since it was so close to the port. The location of the hotel is great! Across the street is the Bayside Market place where there is a lot of shopping, restaurants, and a live band playing. The Market place is located right along the beach so a lot of the restaurants have outdoor seating which is nice on a 70 degree evening. That being said, the only time I would stay here is for one night. The check-in was smooth and the staff were friendly. You can tell that the hotel is older, but has been remodeled. We had to take the elevators to the top floor where our room was, and I was never more scared in my life! The elevators would shake as you were going up! Once we got inside our room, there was an odor of musty basement, bad feet, and fart! Thank goodness for the Bath and Body works at the Market place so we could purchase some air freshener. After that it wasn't that bad, I guess once the air freshener wears off you get used to the smell. There was a small fridge in the room, but there was spilled something inside of it. The bathroom was clean, and the bedding appeared to be clean as well. I did not notice anything foreign that should not have been there. The view from our room was great, it overlooked the Market place and the the ocean. I can't say strongly enough that other than going to the marketplace, I would not venture around too much. At night my husband and I went for a walk down the street to check out what else might have been around. We were met by several homeless people begging for money and digging through garbage cans. I did not feel safe as this road is not heavily traveled at night and there are not other people out walking around either. I recommend eating at the Marketplace across the street.
