The prices at the hotel restaurant are expensive. All in all it was a good stay for the price we payed. I would stay here again if I were to go on another cruise. I would just pack air freshener and request a room on the 2nd floor :)

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Stay”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadalways
Reviews.Content: Traveled for a quick trip to Miami, The hotel was in a perfect location at the heart of the arena and waterfront park area. Our view was amazing. Hotel room was clean and standard holiday inn quality, good. Parking is tricky, on the side, but the attendant/security was amazing, well worth the extra parking cost for the added security. The front desk staff had me checked in and checked out extremely fast. All in all I could not have asked for a better stay. Lots of things to do nearby, wish I had more time. Thanks to the managment and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Serves a purpose, that's it really...”
Reviews.Author: turnbullscans
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at this hotel at the beginning of February 2011 for 3 nights. I was not part of a cruise and had picked this hotel as I thought the location would enable me to explore both Miami downtown and Miami beach in equal measure. I paid around Â£80 GBP per night for the room (not including breakfast), so it wasn't cheap but given the location, thought I would shoulder the relatively high cost. I also placed my trust in the Holiday Inn brand name and thought it certain that I would at least be faced with a relatively high standard of hotel. Check-in was a smooth experience with minimal waiting around. I didn't find the check-in staff to be particularly welcoming and ran through the motions without so much as a flicker of a smile, or indeed any real emotion towards me. Rooms were of a decent size but tired and in need of updating. They also weren't the cleanest and not really in keeping with what I would expect of a Holiday Inn. In terms of other facilities at the hotel, I didn't eat there and I also didn't drink in the bar. Given the proximity to Bayside Wharf and all its bars and restaurants, there isn't really a need to remain at the hotel. In that sense I used the hotel as a base for sleeping and little more. The hotel is well positioned if you are beginning/leaving a cruise from the Port. I would recommend it for those travellers but based on location only. I can't really recommend on any other grounds, particularly not on terms of value or standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not clean”
Reviews.Author: RLB75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in the Port of Miami the night before we left on a family cruise vacation. This was our first trip to Miami, and decided to go with a recognized hotel brand. And because of this, we had expected certain standards. The hotel staff that we encountered were great and we were greeted at check-in by a friendly smile. You really can't beat the location. Its directly across the Bayside Market, with lots of shopping and restaurants. It was a great way to spend the afternoon and evening with our children. Also, the hotel is just minutes away from the Port of Miami. At check out time, we were able to leave the hotel and go right over to our ship without hassle. Although there were several parties/large groups doing the same thing, the staff at the hotel kept things moving along smoothly and we departed without issue. That being said, location is really the only reason to stay at this hotel. The hotel room was okay. It was nothing special which was fine because we were only staying one night. However, our hotel room was dirty. There was a ring of dust around the edge of the room, and tags from the previous occupants shopping trip were in the garbage can. The bathroom was cleaned alright, but not great. I wouldn't take my shoes off in this room - nor did I allow my children to. I called the front desk and they offered to send someone to clean while we were out. When we got back, the room had been vacuumed, and the garbage emptied. We went to bed that night and the next morning got ready to head to the cruise ship. When I flipped over my pillow, there were several long black hairs under it that I had not noticed the night before. My family members all have blonde hair, so I was put off by this find. When I turned on the shower, an assortment of sludge and hair came up the drain. Needless to say, I did not take a shower. To make things worse, my son had kicked his shoe under one of the beds. When my husband went to retrieve the shoe, he found a used condom, and some ones toenail clippings :( . We were completely disguised. For a one night stay over, the Holiday Inn was okay. We didn't use the pool, and we found the restaurant to be over priced. Even the best hotels can have issues, and because we were only staying the one night, we cut our losses and ran (so to speak). I filled out a comment card detailing our experience. I must say though, that when I did call the front desk, the staff tried to help me out. However, despite of the great location, we will probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SuzeEast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights before our cruise. We had a corner room. It was very small but had a very large closet. Really, we were only in our room to sleep so the size didn't matter. There was to much to do. Location was wonderful! Biscayne Market Place directly across the street. Beer store around the corner... To save money don't eat at the hotel restaurant. If you want a sit down breakfast go to the market place Right by the Miami Thriller excursion there is a Latin cuisine restaurant where you get a huge breakfast for 5.95. At the hotel it will cost you 40 bucks for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Bully_Wench
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with husband and friends for one night pre and post-cruise. The biggest advantage for us was the proximity to the pier. We saw our cruise ship from our room window and were only a very short (and cheap) taxi ride away. We also enjoyed being across the street from Bayside Market where you can shop, eat (cheap eateries and higher end restaurants as well), people-watch and take in some live music on the waterfront. The waterfront is simply beautiful at night. Be warned that there is a lot of action in this area and you might want to make sure you have a room on the higher levels and bring earplugs, just in case. Miami has an active nightlife! I'm a very light sleeper but had peaceful nights with my trustee earplugs. We also enjoyed the pool area during the day and went back in the evening to sip some drinks, cool down and unwind. Our travel party's rooms were clean, no complaints from us on that front. The breakfast was okay (standard buffet and a la carte available) and service was very good and friendly. We also walked over to Gloria Estefan's Cuban restaurant, Bongo's, and had an amazing dinner with awesome mojitos (bought the souvenir glass) and Cuban coffee. Overall, I agree with other reviews that the hotel is a bit dated (I hear renovations are in the works?) but I would go back for another short stay pre or post-cruise simply because of the convenience. I also liked the energy of the Bayside Market, which gives you a small glimpse into the Miami heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but also not great”
Reviews.Author: Voost
Reviews.Content: This is very much a mediocre hotel. Definitley not a terrible place to stay but also not fantastic. I like the location a lot. There's lots of great restaurants downtown behind the hotel. The rooms are mostly quiet but you could definitley hear noisy in the rooms nearby and the doors slammed very loud. The wireless connection was pretty good and also a plus. Housekeeping was very good and the other service was adquate: not bad, but also not spectacular. I would recommend this hotel with several caveats, many of which you can read in reviews on this site

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: durango1969
Reviews.Content: We started our cruise off from this hotel and boy let me tell you how horrible this room we stayed in was. The room by the way was 211. The bathroom let see where do i begin oh maybe the mold growing behind the door. Or maybe should i start with how filthy the room was not vacuumed. Or should i state the worst problem of them all was the BLOOD STAINS and OTHER STAINS on the back of the door in the BATHROOM. One last thing there was no noise barrier from outside the strip. So yes we heard some fights out on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!! Lovely hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Cazza_x
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here as a stop over for a few days. We found the hotel staff very friendly. Hotel was very clean throughout! Food was lovely but a little bit on the expensive and so were the drinks! We all loved staying here and if you book the 'millionaire mansion cruise' with them you can get a good discount! Thoroughly enjoyed it and would defiantly go back and recommend to anyone!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to lay your head for a night. But if you want something "nice", this probably isn't it”
Reviews.Author: Tsar_Bomba
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it would have been great about 20 years ago. It looks a little worn and in need of some upgrades here in there to make it anything special. But for the price and given the location...it was ok. We decided to stay there the night before a cruise because of its proximity to the port which proved to be quite good. It was only a 3 or 4 minute cab ride from the cruise ship. It was also directly across the street from Bayside Marketplace which gave us lots to do at night and the next day prior to the cruise. The closet in our room was really big scale-wise compared to the room itself...kind of makes me think that our room may have been renovated at some point and the closet used to be something else. The rest of the room had a pretty small feel to it....yet looking back I remember it had a full sized hutch and a small table...so maybe it just felt small given it's odd shape. Who knows. All in all i'd say the size was "fine". One problem in our room was the bathroom door didn't stay shut. It didn't even line up with the doorframe. I'm guessing this has something to do with how buildings slowy shift over time, but this should be fixed. In a hotel room a bathroom door that doesn't close isn't acceptable. Also, one of the towel bars fell off when I touched it. I carefully hung it back up - something that i'm guessing every guest and housecleaning person has done for a long time. Cleanliness-wise the room seemed decent. If looked in corners behind doors I could find a little grime, hair and stuff like that....but nothing too crazy. The main thing that hindered the room was the simple fact that it came across as dated. So clean or not...it was never really going to wow anyone. We were right next to the dreaded ice-machine room but I have to say I heard nothing. So either it was a dead night on the ice-getting front...or the room has decent soundproofing. Either way, the ice nor anything else woke us up...so kudos to that. The concierges were friendly...as were the front desk staff. None of the staff in the restaurant were overly pleasant though. Overall i'd say it's a decent place to lay your head for a night. But if you're staying for any more that 2 nights and/or want something "nice", this probably isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “FALSE ADVERTISING”
Reviews.Author: luv-2-cruise71
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the night before our upcoming cruise in March. Although I booked through Expedia, I did read up on the hotel on the Holiday Inn's own website. After factoring in the value included in the price BASED ON THE INFO. PROVIDED ON HOLIDAY INN'S WEBSITE, I booked through Expedia since it was a bit cheaper that way. One item of concern is their listed Complimentary Airport Shuttle. This was factored into my decision and when I emailed to ask if I reserve the shuttle or if it would be at the airport, I was told they didn't have a shuttle, I would have to pay for a taxi. When I said it said COMPLIMENTARY SHUTTLE to Miami Airport on THEIR website, I was told they didn't see it. So I sent them a link to their OWN site. Her reply was "yes, but that shuttle is from the airport to the hotel" WHAT?? That is what I need! No reply. This goes back and forth over two weeks so I email head office and their reply was that since I booked through Expedia, I would have to contact them. WHAT? So, I call Expedia and spoke to a VERY RUDE man who said, and I quote "I don't care what their website says, ours does not say anything about the shuttle" I agreed, but still, if they are selling their product, they should offer their services" He then tells me that I am just "not getting it" and says, "so do you want me to cancel your reservation or what?" I told him he did not need to be rude and disrespectful, he says I'm not, do you want me to cancel your reservation or not? Nice service on both parties' behalfs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wd2crv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise and loved the location. The hotel is directly across from Bayside Market so there was plenty of food choices and shopping within walking distance. The cost was the same as hotels near to the airport. The room was really large with a sofa bed and two doubles and the view was stunning. Pool was small, private, nice and while the water was cold, it was reasonable. Staff was very helpful as well! Free Internet was a plus although only one of the two computers in Business center were working.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location would for sure stay again.”
Reviews.Author: scochelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed the few days prior to the miami marathon, where we were lucky enough to get a room because the place was packed! Location is within walking distance of american airlines arena, biscayne outdoor market, and many other cool things! Our room was dirty, which is why i rate it as only an average hotel.. the only rooms they had left were with two doubles, so we pushed the beds together, as we had a small baby to make room for the crib. When moving the beds together, the dust we found under the beds was disgusting! There was also dust on the tp in the bathroom.. That being said, the service from the bellman and the front desk staff was excellent, considering how busy it was they were all able to keep smiling and providing great service. Beds were great too.. as i did get a personal best on the marathon! One more thing.. there was this clock bell that rang every 15 minutes and it sounded like it was right in our room it was so loud.. im not one to complain but seriously that was crazy - EVERY 15 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Close to Cruise Terminal”
Reviews.Author: OttawaFans
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel before heading on a cruise. Nothing negative to report and the service was pretty consistent. We had a large room on the 10th floor that can easily accommodate 5-6 people if using the pull-out sofa bed. The pool area is small but very private & clean. Water is not heated and the area does not get much sun to help raise the temperature in colder months. The view of all the cruise ships in port is spectacular. Bayside Marketplace is directly across the street which provides a fantastic array of restaurants, bars, bistros and boutiques for all tastes and budgets. Live music and local bands are often on-site. Highly recommend this hotel if close proximity to Port of Miami is needed. Always plenty of taxis including mini-vans to transfer guests from the hotel to cruise terminal - 5 minute ride!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Port of Miami - Bayside Downtown - Good hotel close to cruise port & Bayside”
Reviews.Author: Cruiseprincess73 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel. On a main road - but they often are in Miami. Took earplugs - so no problems there and I had expected this. Forewarned is forearmed! Hotel huge with friendly staff, massive lobby and general quality upmarket feel. Small but adequate pool. Small gym with minimal facilities but good for a quick holiday workout. Small office room for guests offering free internet - which was very useful and convenient. Breakfast was incredible with choice of hot and/or continental foods - very good value for money. Concierge arranged Miami tour for us - good value and good tour -pick up/drop up from front of hotel. Hotel is a 2 min walk across the road to the Bayside Marina. There is a large selection of shops (some pricey and some affordable) and also touristy market booths selling numerous Miami and Caribbean items at reasonable costs. Hats, tshirts, caps, jewellery - usual stuff. The marina and boats are in themselves a pleasant aspect to walk around. Loads of bars and restaurants offering allsorts of food including Hard Rock Cafe, Hooters, posh Italian place and also loads of take away food joints. Fantastic crepe stall!! Music/entertainment going on into the evening. If you have just a night or two, perhaps before a cruise and are not fussed about being close to the beach then this is ideal. I think there were also regular shuttle buses (fee to pay I think) to the beach and other shopping areas. I would be happy to stay again if we cruise from Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “One night pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis B
Reviews.Content: Loved the location! Yes it's a touristy area, but we were tourists. Many places to eat just across the street in the Bayside area. Check in went smoothly. Very strong smell of mildew when exiting the elevator on the 10th floor. No odor in the room. The free Internet was greatly appreciated! The bed & pillows were comfortable. Had a wonderful view of the port so we could see the cruise ships coming and going. Very easy to catch a cab in the morning to the Port of Miami from the hotel. There were taxis lined up across the street just waiting for the bellman to wave one over. Over all a very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: gymstx
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, brother in law and I stayed here before our cruise. I was concerned after reading some reviews but I was quite surprised. I thought the hotel was very nice. The staff was friendly and checked us in right away. We had a nice room with two double beds and a sofa bed on the 8th floor. We had a great view of the cruise ships! I loved being across from the shops and restaurants. We walked there in the day time and night time and never felt uneasy. We also walked to CVS pharmacy at night, a couple blocks away. The only complaint I would say is that I hate double beds. I don't know why hotels have them. How many couples at home sleep on double beds? More hotels need to have queen size beds! Other than that, I have no complaints. If we ever cruise out of Miami again, I will be staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: UkLioness
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to a Cruise. The location is great, due to its proximity to the Port of Miami and being just across the road from Bayside Shopping Mall is also bonus as there were lots of restaurants and shops to visit. Bayside Mall is a lovely place and I would visit there again. There is also a CVS Pharmacy down the road to the right when you exit the hotel - this was very handy, to pick up a few things. You can get a bus to Lincoln Road/South Beach from outside Bayside Mall and the bus stops right outside the hotel on your return. We had requested a twin-bedded room on a high floor overlooking the bay. When we opened the door we saw a double-bedded room, on a low floor facing the back. We swiftly went back to reception and explained that we had paid for a twin-bedded room. We eventually got the room that we asked for, although it was still on a low floor and still at the back. But we weren't staying long, so that was not really an issue. The room was ok, and the beds were comfortable enough. The walls seem to be thin and we could hear people in the next room talking loud, when we were trying to sleep. The corridors, show small signs of wear and tear, so it could do with some renovation. I would not stay there longer than 2 nights, but the hotel is good value and and I would stay here again, if I was going on a Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can't afford South Beach”
Reviews.Author: richs123 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location really, directly opposite Bayside Marketplace which was prefect for nights out. Bus to South Beach went from directly opposite hotel every 10-20 minutes so it was ideal for that too. Metromover station only a minute's walk although we didn't use it. Hotel was a little dated but all clean, lovely breakfast (it's not included but they give you a $20/day voucher which pays for two people), really friendly serving staff (reception staff and concierge a bit gruff tho). Internet connection/computers never seemed to be working when we wanted them, and room didn't get cleaned one day although it was 1st Jan so we forgave after they took breakfast charges off the bill. Car parking for $12/day is good value. I would stay here again if I went to Miami, but to be honest Miami was a big disapointment and I'd go for Fort Lauderdale next time.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: rotterdamboy
Reviews.Content: nice location, close to shopping mall.would be nice to have drinks machines on all floors. lifts can get very busy if cruise boats are in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: oldtwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here before our cruise. This is our first time to Miami so I read lots reviews about this hotel. It ended up the good choice after all. Across stree is a Market Place shopping area, also have a Starbuck's there and I walked over there each morning for coffee. There is also a CVS store two door down on the right side of hotel, we bought some stuff and wine for our cruise. Super conveineint!!! There is a good tip about getting around....we met this van driver at the airport, he charged us $5 each person to the hotel. Later on I found out taxi costs over $30. So we have him take us everywhere durning our whole time staying in Miami. He charged the same price everywhere we go for $5 per person for one way. We just gave him a call for the pick up time and he will show up on time. He works for LS Transportation and his name is Fabian Carrera (Phone# 786-277-7394). A driver we trust!!!!! very honest!!! reliable!!! He did make our trip much easier and save us some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Basketball”
Reviews.Author: Kimi1986
Reviews.Content: We booked late and stayed for only one night. We had come down to Miami for our return flight to the UK. We have never been before but knew we wanted to see the Heat while we were in Town. The Holiday Inn was right accross the street from the venua and provided a base for our nights stay. I dont think that I would return to that location again but if needed another nights stay would possibly chosse the hotel again. The room we had was very clean and provided all we needed for the night. A bit small if we were to be staying any loger. the wardrobe was not very big and not much space to put clothes, jsut a chest of draws. the bathroom was small though had a lovely shower. We got a good nights sleep untill about 7am when there was a clock outside that chimed on every hour and half of the hour! This was very annoying when trying to get decent sleep when we had a very long day with flying home. Staff were helpfull. Please note we had to pay $12 for parking for just the night. I dont really like paying for parking when you have booked a room with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: Curlywurly3669
Reviews.Content: Have used this Hotel twice before for both Pre and Post Cruise trips and had nothing but praise for the Hotel and Staff. This time, not as pleased as before. On both previous occasions, we paid for a Kingsize room with a Queensize pullout bed and had terrific views of both Bayside and the Cruise Port from Floors 9 & 10. This trip, we once again paid for the same style of room and were disappointed to find we were placed in room 202 on the 2nd Floor. Not only were we right above a Bus Stop and the main Road, we were also directly above the ongoing refurbishment of the Hotel (think they are turning the old Luggage storeage area into the new entrance to the new Restaurant). Wouldnt mind but there was no mention of any Refurbishment being carried out when we made our booking through the HI website. As soon as we entered the room, all we could hear was banging, crashing, drilling, hammering Etc and this went on for a few hours. We went down to Reception to ask if there were any other rooms available with a front facing view, higher up, and was told no. We mistakenly thought by paying for a more expensive room, we would experience the excellent views and comfort we`d previously had. Was informed by one of the Reception staff that it didnt matter how much we paid for a room, it wouldnt guarantee that we would get room on 9 or 10. Would be nice if the Hotel website had a facility to enquire wether or not rooms on floors you like are available on the dates you want to stay. Luckily, the Building work stopped over the weekend so we had a couple of days of peace. Apart from that, If we can get the rooms again on 9 or 10 on our next visit to Sunny Miami, we will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - make sure you get a check out receipt!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaonthegoco
Reviews.Content: In September 2009, my sister and I prepaid a room for one night before a 4 day cruise with Royal Carribbean. It was $83 plus taxes.(a Sunday night). We enjoyed the Bayside market across the street, we did a harbor cruise and supplied ourselves with last minute take alongs at the drugstore up the street before heading for the ship on Monday. We felt the $83 charge was about right for the age and condition of the hotel. We walked out front of the hotel and hired a yellow marked taxi only to find that it didn't have it's meter on. We had a very personable taxi driver who proceeded to tell us the fare was $20 to the port... nice try. We told him we would give him $10. (2 people plus 2 carry on bags). THIS year we decided to do the trip again a month later, October 17th so we once again tried every discount program we have and came up with $136 PREPAID plus taxes for the same room type. We had 3 rooms bringing husbands and parents. On check in, we gave our credit card even knowing that there wouldn't be ANY charges as it was only an overnight stop before our cruise. We had a large line in the lobby the next morning. We decided to head for the port and caught a big yellow taxi for 6 to the port. ($12 plus tips 6 people - 6 bags) with a meter. Whe we got back home, my sister's credit card was charged $75.00 by the hotel. She called the hotel and was told it was a "hold" and would fall off after a few days... This was a credit card! My credit card was charged $76.32 on a day after we had left on the cruise. When I called the hotel I was told the charge was for the restaurant, when I said we hadn't used the restaurant I was told the charge was for 18 boxes of children's cereal to the room ???? What? The bookkeeper said he would reverse it in a few days... If you stay here make sure to get a check out receipt and monitor your credit card statement afterwards. Visa said they would dispute this for us. Visa said they hadn't heard of this excuse before... No accusations but very curious that

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rluz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before we went on a cruise. The staff was wonderful, the location was incredible. So many thing to go right across the street from the hotel. The ride to the port was less than 10 minutes and only $6.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for Cruise one nite stay”
Reviews.Author: gvrct
Reviews.Content: Didn't have any of the problems I had read about online. I was only there for one night before my cruise. The location was perfect with the Bayside Market and cruise port right across from the hotel. Don't know what an extended stay would be like because you're right downtown Miami but we had a blast the night we stayed. The hotel is a little old but was clean from what I could see. Rooms were larger than expected. Next time I curise out of Miami I will definently use it again.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only but the best night ever!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerKnows
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before going on my Cruise. The attendants at the front desk were very accommodating to my needs. I was pleasantly surprised about my room it was very clean and roomy plus I loved the view from the 10th floor. Also, there is a great restaurant located on the premises just in case you did not want to leave the hotel. This hotel was in walking distance to the nightlife at the harbor, but if you wanted to ride to South Beach it will cost you $25.00 and the ride to the port will run you about $12.00. If you want to want to relax or get your romance on this is a great hotel to be at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: irishpaddyOffaly
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time to stay at the Holiday Inn. It is a lovely hotel and the staff were very friendly and helpfull with any questions we had. The bedroom was very clean and spacious.Just across the road you will find Bayside Marketplace with plenty of shops,restaurants and bars with fab cocktails, its also a great place at night as there is live music. The cruise port is just a 5 min taxi ride away which is all important for your long awaited cruise. We stayed at the Holiday Inn before and after our cruise its a great location and we are looking foward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel to the cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Stooch
Reviews.Content: If you need pre- or post-cruise accommodation, this hotel is a good choice as it's close to the cruise ship terminals. It's right across the road from the Bayside Marketplace with it's shops, restaurants and marina (where you can do a boat trip around Star Island, etc.). Overall the hotel was nice and although the decor was a bit old-fashioned, it was clean and tidy. For what you get, it's reasonably priced, too.

Reviews.Title: “Port of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Port of Miami is in downtown Miami opposite the harbor. ItÂ´s a good location for an evening at the harbor promenade. You can find there live music, cocktails, restaurants and the hard rock cafe. The hotel is quiet old and would need to be renovated. The pool is very small. But the staff was very friendly. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Renee T.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel 1 day pre-cruise. We arrived 4 hours early and we were checked in. The staff was friendly and efficent. When we ordered room service, they called to ask how our food was (even though it was mediocre!). We had a nice view of bay and the room was nice and comfy with plenty of pillows! We shopped at the Bayside market which is right across the street and had a great time. For breakfast we had the buffett in the restaurant. The food was fresh and hot and about the same price as Mcdonalds. Since it was too early to leave for our cruise, we decided to do some more shopping! They were happy to hold our bags until we were ready to leave. We came back to the hotel, collected our bags and a cab was waiting for us. Within 10 minutes we were at the pier! This hotel is great for pre and post cruise stays. I would stay here again!.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lorie43
Reviews.Content: My husband John and I stayed at the Holiday Inn at the Port of Miami on September 9th 2010 for 2 nights before taking our Carnival Liberty Cruise. I must say everytime we stay it is just wonderful. Rosa and her staff are pleasant, caring and attend to our every needs during our stay. The rooms are spacious and CLEAN. I can't wait to bring my extended family next year to this beautiful hotel. On a whole we can't wait to come back. Thanks to every one. Laurita

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: emporerpenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here. It was the best price downtown for a well known chain. We had a comfortable stay. The room itself was very comfortable, however the bathroom was small and a bit shabby. The breakfast was excellent. I was a bit disappointed as the hotel is a bit dated, however I would stay here again but only as a one night sleepover.

Reviews.Title: “Shady, Shady Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: EBScott
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this Holiday Inn off of the port of Miami. I was very upset with the front desk. When we first arrived, the lady advised me that I would need to put down a deposit of $25 dollars because we were paying partial in cash. ( fine) After about two hours waiting for our room to be ready, the front desk then says that instead of $25, they need to hold $50! Also we rented a scooter and my husband paid $12 for a day to park the scooter in their parking lot. Once we were trying to leave, the lady at the front tried to keep out $50 saying that my husband didnt bring back the parking sticker that was attached to the scooter?? ( No one told him that he would have to return a sticker? that he placed on the scooter) THEN she tries to say that he parked for the two days that we stayed, and tried to take some of our deposit! She tried so hard to find any excuse to take our money.... this place is near everything but Miami is SHADY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Night Before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: MaribethK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent for an overnight visit. We stayed here the night before we went on a Carnival Cruise. We had reservations and arrived at 8pm Sunday night. We were in our room within minutes of arrival. We felt the room and bathrooms were clean and tidy. We had a beautiful view from the 6th floor of the Bayside Mall and the bay area. We could see our ship from the window. The Bayside Mall is directly across the street and easily accessible by foot. There is a lot of outdoor activity and music and shopping. A great night life place. There is a CVS 1 block from the hotel. This was convenient for us to pick up our botteled water for the cruise ship, plus a few last minute items. We had no problems with the staff, but felt the breakfast buffet was a bit pricey for the selection. Nonetheless, the food was good. And, we were placed in a connecting room, so we could hear the people in the next room, but they did not stay up to late. Igave the sleep quality a 3 for this rerason, plus the beds are firm and I like a plush bed! I would still recommend this hotel and use again for a hotel one night prior to a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stubbyvan
Reviews.Content: Stay here during an extended trip to the USA. Awful cannot find anything good to say about the hotel. The people in the next room was noisy every night until 4am went on for 4 nights the staff did nothing about it. We even booked into another hotel to get a nights sleep. There was rubbish lefted for days in the corridor. Our beds were not made up during our stay we had to ask at 5pm.the staff were poor,, it was just a question of book them in and ship them out. The bayside is a good area to stay but there are better hotels there than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aboyer8
Reviews.Content: My finace and I stayed here for one night before our cruise out of the Port of Miami. It was exactly what we needed. The hotel is older, but nice. The front desk was very friendly and they have a business center that is free to use including internet. The room was dated, but comfortable and had everything we needed to make our one night there enjoyable. The hotels has a lot of cruisers. So we were able to hang out by the pool even after we had checked out while we waited for the cruise. And it was very reasonably priced, especially considering that it is in the heart of down town. The best part of the hotel was the location. You really couldn't beat it. It is right at the enterance for the Port of Miami, a very reasonable taxi ride from the hotel to the cruise check in. There is so much to do right aroudn the hotel. There is a nice outdoor mall right across the street. We walked over there for dinner and loved it. There were places to go dancing, a band playing on an outdoor stage, and lots of shops. The Hardrock is there too. In the morning, we got up and walked around downtown. The People Mover (a free tram that runs around downtown) is only one block up from the hotel. We rode it all over. If you are looking for a place to crash before a cruise or are looking for a reasonable place to sleep while you explore the Miami area, this hotel is great. If you are looking for a more upscale, hang out by the pool hotel, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: GypsyEyes
Reviews.Content: Since I was given one of the back rooms I missed the view of the ships everyone raves about. However I did get to enjoy the gently reassuring church bells that softly rang at 15-minute intervals from the United Methodist Church next door. If you forget to close the curtains, make sure you wave to the folks passing by on the Metromover! The bed was comfortable, it was quiet, and the staff attentive. I would highly recomend it for people going on a cruise out of the Port of Miami or for those attending a concert across the way at Bayfront Park.

Reviews.Title: “Our son's camera was stolen by staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_around1
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night (pre-cruise). Our son packed his digital camera in his backpack. The next morning, we checked out at 11, had breakfast at the lobby restaurant and got into a cab. Just before the cab drove away, my son noticed his camera missing. We went back into the hotel and asked for a key to get back into the room. At 11:45 we entered the room and immediately noticed that the bed covers had already been removed but the rest of the room was untouched. At this point my son told me that the backpack had fallen to the floor from the sofa bed (he was sleeping on the sofa bed) during the night. We looked everywhere in and around the sofa and the entire room. The housekeeping supervisor spoke to both maids that had been in the room and was told that they found nothing. The front counter staff showed no interest at all in the situation and suggested that it maybe fell out somewhere else. Considering that my son had the pack with him, including at the restaurant (we also went there to check) someone in our group of 9 would have noticed if it had fallen out on the tile floor. There is no doubt that it was found and kept by one of the hotel staff. The location to the port is great but there is no way we will ever give this or any other Holiday Inn another penny in revenue.

Reviews.Title: “Average Holiday Inn that serves it purpose - pre and post cruise”
Reviews.Author: moju1972
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the Port of Miami, so used by cruise ship passengers pre and post cruise, and that is the sole purpose of this hotel, which it serves well. Also across the street from Bayside marketplace with a variety of restaurants, food court, Haagen Dazs, and shopping, which is convenient. There is a McDonald's around the back of the hotel. The rooms and general decor of the hotel is tired and needs updating. I had a 10th floor executive room, which was pretty basic. The bathroom looked newer and was clean. During my stay it was pretty quiet, but there were some notices around the hotel reminding guests that they are downtown and to expect some noise. The staff were friendly and helpful. If you are cruising, be aware that it gets really busy in the morning - every family of four x 2 pieces of baggage each trying to leave at the same time - and that means long waits for the elevators and queus at the check out desk, so try to get down early. I ate a la carte breakfast and it was just about decent. They have a buffet for breakfast as well and the same restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. The food is average at best. I paid $ 135 including tax for this hotel. I would have paid much more for a South Beach location, and it was only a short taxi ride away, or you can take the bus - the bus stop is right across the street - so the hotel is value for money, though you can stay in non-brand name hotels in South Beach for less. Overall, I paid for the HI brand name to be assured of at least some standard of cleanliness and service. What I got was just about acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: Nicci0595
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter, my best friend and her 8 year old daughter stayed here the day before and after. When checking in after midnight, the guest services person was very nice and friendly. We were excited about the location. Upon entering the room, it receked with oder. I had airfreshner and sprayed everything down. With it being so late, we all prepared for bed. As my daughter was letting out the sleeper couch, we learned that the sheets were nasty and had not been changed. Auugghh... Because it was after midnight, I had to meet security at the linen closet to get clean sheets and then proceed to make the bed. As we were preparing to take showers, we learned that the towels were also not clean. Come on now... After all of that, they gave us free breakfast. Because we only needed a couple of hours to lay our heads down for the cruise, we accepted that since there were no other rooms available. Location is idea... Enjoyed hanging out at the Bayside Market Place. Also walked down the block to CVS. That was idea... The day we returned from the cruise, we had a better room but you can tell the hotel needs a little remodeling. Still had an oder in the room. Overall, it met our needs. However, we would have stayed somewhere else if the surrounding hotels were not already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruisers; nice view of the water”
Reviews.Author: Milocat007
Reviews.Content: Room was nice; bed was comfortable; view was great. It's located near the port and near some party venues, so expect a little noise. When we cruise out of Miami, we'll definitely stay there again. 5 minute taxi to port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.... Safety issues....”
Reviews.Author: jchrascal
Reviews.Content: We stayed post cruise for one night before some family members flew home the next day after our Norwegian cruise. I was a little concerned for our safety when we were told at check in to empty our car of all our belongings, suitcases etc and not leave anything in the car due to vandalism/ robbery issues!! We had packed a small suitcase for this stay but then had to unload our whole car and take everything up to our room.... what a hassle. Our room was comfortable. We had a ton of stuff because we had been traveling for so long. We went to Bayside marketplace and had fun, good meal at Bubba Gumps and nice scenery. We ordered pizza at night and the pizza delivery man had to be escorted to our room by the hotel security guard. That was different! We had a Bayside facing room and at night I noticed individuals wandering and loitering in the parking lot in front of the hotel. There were sirens and police evident. Obviously not a great area to be in after dark!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Port of Miami”
Reviews.Author: sandylem
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location near the Port of Miami as we were leaving next day on a cruise. This hotel does not disappoint. It is very convenient to the Port and has big comfortable rooms. Right across the road there is a big shopping centre with plenty of places to eat and shop. This hotel also has a laundry which was fantastic for our friends tas they had been travelling for a while and needed to catch up on some washing. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sandylynnclark
Reviews.Content: Overall the actual Hotel wasn't bad....room was fine etc....HOWEVER....DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES LEAVE YOUR LUGGAGE IN THE LUGGAGE ROOM while you wait for your room. This location is apparently known for theft....We left our luggage in the holding room as our room was not ready....We went across to the Biscayne Market for lunch and shopping....upon returning to the hotel and getting our luggage, I noticed that my carry on bag zippers were open....good thing there was nothing of value and that I didn't leave my camera or money in it.....they did ABSOLUTELY nothing about it....will not stay there again, just read other reviews where the same thing happened.....carry all values with you......

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: moju72
Reviews.Content: This was an average Holiday Inn. The staff were friendly and helpful. The decor in public areas as well as the rooms looked tired and needs updating, but the bathroom looked newly refurbished in my 10th floor room. The location is across the street from Bayside marketplace and the Port of Miami. It is value for money compared to South Beach hotels and you can get to South Beach/Miami Beach easily by taxi or bus. The bus stop is across the street. All day trips and sightseeing tours leave from this hotel. There is a shuttle ($10) to Dolphin Mall.

Reviews.Title: “TRANSPORTATION NEEDED TO PORT OF CALL”
Reviews.Author: Joyced01
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were great, went on a cruise, let us leave our luggage until time for cruise (WONDERFUL) room great, view great, feel that transportation across the bay to port of call should be part of the services of Holiday Inn. Will go to another hotel when we cruise again because of this issue, we are seniors and our 1st experience with transportation to the port of call would have been less nerve racking had it been there to use. Thanks Joyce Davis

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought.”
Reviews.Author: WendyMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before a cruise. The hotel turned out to be better than I thought. We got a room with two double beds and a pull out sofa. Pretty roomy. I like that it was right across the street from Bayside Marketplace. The pool is open until about 10 pm. Don't really like how you have to walk through the restaurant to and from the pool though. It was noisy outside at night. Lots of cars beeping and sirens. I was more impressed by appearance and service. They stored our bags for us while we went down to the beach for the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to marina area”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1G
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite as SPG members, which was very nice - two large rooms that were in fairly good condition for an older hotel, overlooking Biscayne Blvd. The room rate included internet and there was also a good coffee maker in the mini kitchen area. The location is really good for proximity to the marina - you could just hear the horn blast when various cruise ships were leaving the port, and we only needed to across the road where were all sorts of shops in the arcades and restaurants around the marina - seafood, Italian, Mexican, burgers, ice cream, coffee shops. Great to sit there and watch people walk by and boats come and go. Staff were helpful - keen to also "assist you" with excursion bookings however still helpful. Taxi fare was only $10.00 to get to the cruise terminal for Oceania.

Reviews.Title: “Just right....right place, right price”
Reviews.Author: Cabana-Boy-and-Girl
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on where to stay for one night before our cruise. I considered several places out by the airport with the thought that I would only have to pay one taxi fare in the morning to the cruise terminal since most of the airport hotels provided transportation from the airport to the hotel. The Holiday Inn did not provide transportation from the airport, or to the pier. You are on your own and there are pubic transportation alternatives to taxis if you have more time than money. I am glad we decided to stay at the Holiday Inn. The place is not new, and just a bit "run down around the heels", but the location is great. You can get right into the sprit of a vacation by crossing the street and walking along the waterfront park, taking a water tour on the "Island Princess" (which is what we did), or sit down and have a drink overlooking the bay. Lots of restaurants, tourist stuff, street acts, and shops. Back to the hotel....... Our room was clean, the staff helpful. They have a full service restaurant and we had the buffet breakfast and a conventional breakfast there which was very plentiful with good service and lots of coffee from the container they leave on your table. There is a Ronald McDonalds House of Delight right behind the hotel if that is your desire. The hotel is a short block away from the free mono-rail that loops around the business district of the city, but it was just as bad as the reviews I had read about vagrants and homeless being the only other passengers on weekends. The taxi ride from the hotel to the pier took all of 10 minutes if that. The hotel was more than willing to hold your luggage if you wanted to checkout, walk around, and return later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the harbour and cruises”
Reviews.Author: AnteBante
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at this hotel. The location was perfect for us, right across the street was a small little marina with shops, entertainment and restaurants. We could also see all giant ships going in and out through the harbour. The rooms were a little shabby and old, but the overall from this hotel was good!

Reviews.Title: “We were ROBBED and the hotel did not care!!!”
Reviews.Author: kafletch
Reviews.Content: Before leaving for a cruise with three friends we stayed at this hotel for one night. On the morning we were checking out we went downstairs to get breakfast before heading to the ship. We were only out of the room for about 30 minutes. One of us went up to the room first and walked in on a man who said he was "in the wrong room and thought it was his friends' room." When my friend went to the phone to call the front desk the wires were ripped out so that the phone had no dial tone. The rest of us then got up to the room right as he was trying to call and he told us what happened. He then ran down the stairs to find the guy and/or go to the lobby and tell the hotel to call the police. We had a watch, ipod, laptop, and cash stolen, a total of about $2000. It took the hotel a while to call the police and the front desk manager kept asking my friend if the man was wearing a uniform (as if asking did he look like he worked here). He was able to give the police a pretty good description of the guy. While dealing with the police, we figured out that the only two cameras in the hotel, in the front lobby and the back staircase to the parking lot, were not working. Our room was on the top floor, right by those back stairs where the guy ran out. When we went to check out after dealing with all of this for about 2 hours, the front desk manager informed us that she did not have the authority to give us a free room. She said that only the general manager could do that and the general manager already spoke with the police and had left for the day. I asked her to call him so that I could talk to him, but he did not answer his phone. She said that she would temporarily not charge the room, but about 2 weeks after the stay my credit card was charged the full amount of the room. I have called and left at least 5 messages on the general manager's voice mail to call me back and he has not made any attempt to do so. The front desk manager from that day did however call me back after I had left a few messages and asked what I needed. I told her that I had already talked with her and she said she could not help me, so I would like to talk to the general manager. She said that he was gone and she would tell him to call me. He still has not and I continue to leave messages for him. When I explained the situation to her she seemed to not remember the guests that stayed in the hotel and spoke with her all morning in January after being robbed. It's scary that a hotel would not remember a robbery, especially when she is the one who spoke with us and the police. I have since tried to leave more messages for the general manager and have still not heard anything. This was a horrible start to our vacation and the worst part about it is that the hotel did not even care that people staying at their hotel had their room broken into and were robbed. They only seemed worried about making sure to cover up any possibility of fault. I would advise anyone looking for a hotel not to stay here. The fact that it was close to the port was the only plus and it was definitely not worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Visit”
Reviews.Author: TropiCAL2003
Reviews.Content: The location is great, we came in for two days before our cruise left on 3/6/10. We are Priority members so keys were ready and check-in was fast. There are a few steps to get up to lobby if you come in through the rotating door which can be difficult with luggage (another guest helped us); use the side door w/ramp for access. The hotel is older and elevators can be interesting when you go up each floor (clicks each time). We had a top floor bayside view which we enjoyed watching cruise ships come and go. Bed was quite comfortable and room was clean. Shower Gel was not provided which I am accustomed to at other Holiday Inns - so I had to buy some at Bath and Body across the street in Bayside Village. One BIG problem we had the last day we were out sightseeing and when we returned the maid had put AC on full blast - it was like 50-60 degrees in the room. We tried the heater to no avail and finally after hours of freezing called for engineering and found out there is NO heat in this hotel! They ONLY have AC that works. So in cold winter temps do not even try the heater as it will only blow out cold air. The hotel managerâ€™s resolution was to have housekeeping bring us two blankets. Internet worked fine, this was a working vacation for me. TV remote quit working so engineering brought us a replacement (but left original so it was confusing at times). Bell cap was great in getting luggage to the room and helping us get a cab when we left, as well as giving us public transport directions to the Vizcaya Museum & Gardens which was definitely a worthwhile trip to do over several hours when you visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelman1979_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago the night before going on a cruise. The hotel was only minutes to the Port and was very nice, clean and accomadating. I would definetely recommend this hotel if in the Miami area or would like to spend a few days in Miami area before cruising. The Miami Heat play across the street as well, so if you need a hotel, this is the perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, service not so great...”
Reviews.Author: pdxtraveler2
Reviews.Content: Pre-cruise stayâ€¦ location is great, simply walk across the street to a nice recreation area on the bay (food, shopping, etc). Cruise ships are a short cab ride away. Cab from Miami airport was about $42. Our room was considerably smaller than I was expecting having stayed at many hotels â€“ no complaints, still larger than the room on our cruise. Hotel is older, but clean. Pool was small, but whatever. One block from the metromover if you need get out (highly recommended for dinner â€“ the hotel restaurant / bar service was horrible). All in all, Iâ€™d probably stay again just for the location. If anything is cheaper / better deal within a few blocks â€“ Iâ€™d consider that as well.

Reviews.Title: “served my purpose well- good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mcvall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Miami the day before our Cruise to the Bahamas was to depart, and chose this hotel because it is very close to the Port of Miami (ten minute or less cab ride). The hotel is right across the street from American Airlines Arena and the Bayside Marketplace, which has many shops and restaurants. I recommend this hotel if you want a place to stay for one night, maybe before or after a Cruise. The hotel is decently clean and staff was friendly, but if you want luxury this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the port but...”
Reviews.Author: Wildchild2538
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night post-cruise and that was enough. The hotel is very noisy. Staff were friendly but I would definately stay somewhere else. Oh... and DO NOT order the pizza at the restaurant downstairs... what a waste of money. Fare from the hotel to the airport was $24.00 (but then again, they all charge the same flat rate to go to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Good before/after cruise”
Reviews.Author: fairydust_01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night after a cruise. Because we got there early in the morning, the staff held our bags until our room was ready. This hotel is located across the street from Biscayne street shopping center. This is an outdoor shopping center on the water with vendors and restaurants. $20 taxi ride from port after the cruise. $20 taxi ride to airport. The hotel has a restaurant inside, which was a little expensive for breakfast. Business center with use of computers to print boarding passes for airport. Also has a pool, but I did not use it. Hotel was very clean and staff was reasonably helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn' recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: petitetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel overnight at beginning of March. We chose it because we were going on a cruise the following day and it was close to the port. Location was fine, just across from Biscayne Bay with shops and restaurants. The room itself was poor. The door didnt fit properly, it had gaps around it. The furnishings were shabby and the ventilation shafts were clogged with grease and dirt. It wasnt expensive, but I would have expected better. Wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: mystyou
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night on March 6 prior to embarking on a Royal Caribbean cruise the next day. We arrived at approximately 3 PM and were treated with a lot of courtesy and efficiency. They had a small sign at the check-in desk that was kind of funny considering how cold FL has been. "Sorry about the cold weather. Please be advised that our hotel isn't heated." There was no need to use the AC that night and it was quite comfy. Our room was on the 5th floor facing the Bayside Market and port. We could clearly see two Carnival ships berthed there. The Bayside was right across the street and VERY convenient for last minute shopping and finding a good place to eat. Just 2 blocks from the hotel was a CVS in case you forgot sun tan lotion, etc. Our room had two full size beds, was clean and comfy. Check in and check out was handled with a smily by the desk personnel. The hotel offered a breakfast buffet on Sunday for just $12/pp. They had a great selection of food with friendly staff. Unfortunately, they didn't have a shuttle to the pier so had to take a cab for $5. Not too bad and we weren't jammed into some sort of shuttle with lots of other people. Others have mentioned how slow the elevators were. Both were working perfectly for us and were rather quick. The 3rd elevator was a service one and not for general use. To sum up, a nice, clean, relatively inexpensive, convenient place to stay pre-cruise. I will definately stay there again next time I cruise out of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “All about Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnHog
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel is dated, the location to the Bayside Mall, Port Terminal, Air America Arena, is second to none. Do not eat here..simply go across the street. I was able to go for a 4 mile run in Downtown Miami, prior to our cruise. Surprisingly quite clean and safe area. Staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place in great location”
Reviews.Author: sean48183
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good for what it was. We had a one night lay over in miami the night be for our cruise left out and this hotel served quite well. Lady at front desk was a little surly but she did keep things moving quite well. Door men were friendly and will keep your bags in a locked room before and after check out if you have time to kill. It is located right across from the bayside mall and right down the street from the port of miami. We took a $15 dollar cab ride(which are real easy to find) to south beach(which is a must see if you like to party). The breakfast buffet in the resteraunt was excellent. It is not a cheap hotel but then again nothing in miami is. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.Terrific view !”
Reviews.Author: ScottishlassAlice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for both pre and post cruise. We asked for, and were given, a high room, 9th floor overlooking the bay & port. We found the hotel to be fine, albeit dated in structure.The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms functional and again clean. The large bed was as good a bed as we have ever slept in .The room overlooked Bayside Market, and the Port in the distance. It was lovely to awake the first morning and look at the cruise ships whilst the sun rose. We didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to eat in Bayside, but we looked at the menu and the choice appeared quite adequate and several guests ate both breakfast & evening dinner. The prices were in keeping with many of the local restaurants and if you are a Priority member you will get $5 discount. It is possible to order food from delivery services as flyers are put into each room and local calls are free. We bought a bottle of wine and nibbles from Walgreens ( a couple of blocks to the right as you come out of the hotel. There is also a CVS Pharmacy closer, but we didn't use it so cannot comment ) and drank it in our room before, and after dinner, whilst enjoying the views from our comfortable chairs. We agree with others that the elevators could be a problem, but we have to admit that we didn't encounter any. There is a sign stating that during peak times, 10.30 - 12.30 the elevators will be busy as check out time is 11.00. We were fortunate that when we checked out on both occasions we did not experiemce any problem. The reception and concierge staff were all very pleasant and helpful. On our post cruise stay, we arrived early,( 09.15 to be precise ! ) and were able to check in our cases to a secured luggage room and also complete all paper work so that when we returned later, we just collected our key card from reception. The location of the hotel could not be better for the Port and as we said, is opposite Bayside Market which hosts numerous shops, restaurants, of varying standards and bars. There are free open air concerts twice daily and we sat and enjoyed various performances which would put many a so called artist to shame. The best was probably a Brazilian group, or should we say,a female singer with a backing male group. This is obviously a very popular performance with many locals turning out in great support for them. On our last day, we stayed 2 nights post cruise, after going to South Beach ( SoBe), by 'C' or 'S' bus, the stop is opposite the hotel ( $2 each, no change given ) we decided to spend a couple of hours by the pool, which was a great sun trap. Although we did not swim as the water was too cold, we did sit at the side with our legs in the water as the sun was hot. We arrived at the pool about 14.30 hours and until we left at 16.30, we were the only people there, although those who used the car park at the side of the hotel walked through the bottom end of the pool area......no real problem.The concierge staff obtained a taxi for all those who required one and although we did not experience any problem getting to the Port ($12 ) or airport ( $25 ), trying to get a taxi to take us from the Port to the hotel ( $10 ) was a slight problem. Most of the taxi drivers want a long fare, such as the airport from the port, so we had a bit of a hassle getting a driver to take us to the hotel, but we did manage after a few failures. Listening to others in the line at the port , we found we were not alone, but we all managed to get a taxi eventually, just be persistent !! We have stayed at various Holiday Inns in the past and although this building is not the most modern, we really could not justify any complaint apart from the sound proofing in the rooms. We had a connecting door, which we do not like, but our view was too good to give up, and we could hear people in the next room, but to be fair, could not make out what they were saying, it was mostly laughter we heard. This hotel seems to be used mostly by cruise passengers, mainly due to it's location and therefore the rush seems to be as stated in the elevators. On our second departure there were no cruise ships in port, so check out was trouble and hassle free. We can only say that our perception of the place was favourable and really, we wanted a clean and comfortable place to stay for a few nights, not a fortnight, and this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive Mistake”
Reviews.Author: cmg2101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December after Christmas. I was disappointed in this property in almost every facet. To begin with, the parking. If you are driving there, a small lot in the back is all you have access to. It is always filled and if you park there, drive to the beach and return there is a good chance there the spot will be gone. The security guard attempted to shake us down for some extra $$ to "hold onto our spot" which I found to be quite awful. The pool is in the shade almost the entire day. The photo online does not do it justice. The pool area is small and sandwiched between the parking lot and the restaurant. The elevators are slow enough to get you frustrated. Really. Also there are no stairs that they allow you to use. This was an issue when we were there. I repeatedly asked if we could use the stairs and were met with rude, short answers. Well Murpheys Law --- we got in an elevator that got stuck and the fire dept had to rescue us. There was no apology from management and the whole episode was quite surreal. I kept saying, I am paying for this? There were bugs in the bathroom. Small little guys walking around. When I commented there was no reaction. Then we had the pleasure of visiting friends down the way at another hotel equidistant to the American Airlines Arena in the other direction. Oh my. For the same money this place was 400 times nicer, with a pool deck with a bar and bartender which faced the sun with no obstructions. Buyer remorse? Yes. Will I be returning? No. I wrote to management about the elevator, bugs and parking. I got a auto generated response. Nothing personal and nothing that made me believe they will address my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Port of Miami Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Punktravel
Reviews.Content: When I arrived my room was ready and the folks at the front desk were nice and helpful. My room was your standard Holiday Inn room. Not bad not great. The room was clean and everything was in working order. I liked the location as the Bayside market is across the street.You can grab a quick meal or drink. If you are going on a cruise, the ships are a only a five min ride. It's very easy to get a taxi in front of the hotel. The area is full of new apartment buildings that seem empty. At night everything closes about 10 PM including the CVS and Walgreens that are down the block. The hotel is priced right. The hallways could use a fixing up. It's a older building compared to all the other buildings in the hood. I would totally stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, noisy and a little dirty, but allright.”
Reviews.Author: Pakk
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami after a cruise recently. The hotel is very conveniently located a few minutes from the port from where the cruise ships departs. It is also just across the road from the Bayside Marketplace which contains a large number of shops and restaurants. The rooms are quite allright; large tv even if not flat with a great number of channels, bathroom with both tub and shower, a large quite comfy bed and free both wireless and wired internet that worked pretty good. The hotel also has a swimming pool and a business center, and I also believe there was a gym. All these were free of charge for guests. The main problem with the room is the noise, the walls seems paperthin, so everytime someone talks in the hallway outside or close their door, you can hear it like they stood next to you. Not a huge problem for us, but for someone more sensitive I belive it would be. Another problem we experienced was that our bathroom wasn't clean, there were stains all over it and the last guests used toiletries were left, resulting in us having to clean the tub before using it. Of course we could have called reception and asked for a better cleaning, but since we only stayed for one night we didn't. The hotel is apart from noisy and our partly unclean bathroom pretty allright, staff is quite nice and food in the restaurant except for soggy french fries were also pretty OK. I could stay here again, but I would first look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Value-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed before and after a Carnival cruise out of Miami, and the hotel is well-located, just a $10 cab ride to and from the ship. Hotel staff are really friendly and helpful. Rooms were well-appointed and clean. There is a small business centre with free internet. Restaurant is adequate for a short stay, and there is not much of a bar. However, across the street and on the water is a complex of bars, restaurant and shops, the italian restaurant being particularly good. Good value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay..especially for pre-cruise!”
Reviews.Author: shsabres
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn pre-cruise, and it wasn't that bad. Besides check in with their incredibly rude staff but besides that it was ok. I booked reservation a year in advance and asked for a port view, however upon arrival they stated that they had no more available (even though I was promised one with a year reservation!!!) So they upgraded me to a suite which was nice. The hotel is very clean and was only $200 a night!! I called for check out and they said they would be up to assist with bags. After waiting almost an hour I went down and got a cart to grab the bags! I would stay here again only because of the location. Across the street from Bayside Marketplace and tons of taxi's to take you to the port at $10. Also, booked a Key West tour that picked us up directly from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripsalot100
Reviews.Content: Wow. That was a bad stay. We stayed here for one night after a cruise. Our room smelled like musty wet carpet. In fact the carpet was soak'n wet!!!! The beds were very tiny and the room was very noisy. The service was terrible and the next day when we were checking out the elevators were not working!!!! I would never stay here again or suggest it to anyone. The only plus was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fgambi1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn after a cruise. The location is very close to the Miami Cruise Port, several restaurants and shopping area, a park, and just across the street from the Bay. The location couldn't have been better for us. We arrived at 10 am and a room was available. The room was a good size and clean. We could hear almost everything going on in the room next to us and down the hall. Thankfully our neighbors were pretty quiet and we slept fine. The elevators were very crowded (and slow) and as a previous reviewer mentioned, you could not access the stairs from the bottom floor. The pool/courtyard area was nice, we relaxed there for a few hours in the afternoon. We also used the gym. It was small but had two treadmills and televisions. The business center offered two computers and a printer, there is also free wireless internet (although the signal was too weak to connect in our room). Our stay was average. Due to the great location and reasonable price, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: southguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for one night on Oct. 24, 2009 in between two cruises. It is half a mile from the Port of Miami. It won't cost you more than $10.00 from or to the Port. This is the reason why they don't provide shuttle service at this Hotel. You are conveniently located across the Blvd. from Bayside Marketplace and Miami Tours Operators.Very decently priced for Downtown Miami. They are very nice and helpful at the reception desk. And you will also be offered a $10.00 reduction coupon for a meal at their Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “great location, close to port and bayside market”
Reviews.Author: ArkSunlover
Reviews.Content: stayed one night after cruise. Close to terminal, clean, comfortable beds, bit noisey because of location. Great shopping, music, resturants across the street. cab ride to port, 5 minutes, cab ride to airport 15 minutes. Would definitely stay there again before or after cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpful Elevators not working”
Reviews.Author: alderion
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pricey the location is great and that's about the only good thing about it. One elevator was completely out of service, the service elevator would sometimes lose it's brain and just randomly go wherever it felt like. The single remaining elevator could take upwards of 45minutes to arrive at your floor. The staff was obviously aware of this but did not offer any assistance to anyone. We had myself my wife and our 21 month old daughter. With 3 check in bags a car seat and 2 carry on bags. The staff just watched us struggle with it all. Internet was free but was not very speedy at all. We stayed at the Hilton airport after our cruise, price was only 10$ night more and the staff assissted us with our luggage without being asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay precruise!”
Reviews.Author: Luuvchis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. I had requested a room facing the port, and that request was honored, for which I am grateful. Also as a Priority club member recieved a 5.00 discount off breafast. The hotel is perfect for location, directly across from the Bayside Marketplace, a nice place to spend the afternoon/early evening before the cruise. Lots of choice for restaurants. There is also a CVS store just a block away where you can buy your last minute cruise provisions, including wine. The hotel is older but well maintained and clean, more than adequate for one or two nights stay. A little pricey, but you cant beat it for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: ffemtrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to a cruise on Majesty of the Seas. Check in was smooth. The room was clean. There was a mildewy smell in the Lobby, but not in the room. The location is excellent. It is directly across from Bayside Marketplace which has several shops, restaurants, and harbor cruise boats. It is a $12 flat rate taxi ride to the port. Went out to exercise early in the morning and didn't encounter any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelnfoooo1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami the night before a cruise. This hotel is in an excellent location for port travelors. It is also directly across the street from the Biscayne Marketplace with lots of shops and restaurants. The pool is very nice in the day. The pool gets a little crowded in the evening with families/kids arriving to go on cruises the next day. There is a CVS just down from the hotel and a McDonalds behind if for breakfast. Keep in mind this is downtown Miami, and there is a large homeless population. McDonalds seemed to be a popular location for the homeless. There is also security in the parking lot to protect your car, if you are driving.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Capette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before cruising out of Miami. The location is amazing as it is right acrosss the street from Bayside Market. A taxi from the airport in Miami was $24.00. Don't be fooled by the hotel shuttles as its cheaper and faster to grab your own cab. The shuttles were $32 for both of us and we had to wait for other people. The front desk staff were very friendly and were quick to help us with towels for the pool, directions, helpful hints on where to buy pre cruise alcohol etc. The room had an amazing view of the harbour and Bayside and was comfortable. The hotel is showing her age but it is kept clean and staff were wonderful and hard working. We loved our one night in Miami and would love to come back just to visit Miami. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: emmysmommy
Reviews.Content: This was a pre-cruise stay for 3 nights. We were looking for a decent hotel near shopping and dining and since Bayside is directly across the street it seemed like a good choice. We booked using the Advance purchase rate and when the rate dropped the hotel refunded us the price difference with no hassles and no problem. (Hilton did not extend the same courtesy but that's the chance you take when you book that rate type.) We booked a King Suite which was very spacious and more than adequate for our needs. It had a living room separated from the bedroom by louvered doors, a small bathroom (hardly any counter space), a separate vanity area (again, small), and small closet in the bedroom. The entryway into the living area had a small kitchenette with a mini fridge (worked wonderfully!), small sink, microwave, and plenty of shelf space for storing food etc. There as also a coffee maker with all the necessary supplies to get your morning caffeine. I believe the King Suite rooms are corner rooms - we had a view looking north on Biscayne Bay and another view looking directly across the street at Bayside. I had read reviews of hearing music from Bayside on weekends but we didn't hear any at all. There were some street noises and I did hear the tour bus that stopped in front of the hotel every morning at 5:30 to pick up passengers for Orlando day trips, but other than that it was a great room in a great location. Our room was only on the 4th floor so we were not high enough to see more of the port area and the ships. We could see most of the Royal Caribbean ship but not any of the Carnival ships.
