There were a few signs of wear and tear in the hotel; most notably in the hallways with old, tired looking carpet and in the bathrooms where there appeared to be layers and layers of paint and patch jobs. This wasn't anything that bothered me, just an observation. We used the hotel gym daily while staying there - it is small but had all two treadmills, 1 bike, an incline bench, and a multi-purpose weight machine for chest, arms, and legs. It had clean towels, a water dispenser, two TVs (one quit working after the 1st day), and a balance scale. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning. If you are a Holiday Inn Priority Club member you receive a "gold" room key that entitles you to $5 off any meal in their restaurant. (They only serve breakfast and dinner.) There is a continental buffet for around $8.99 and a full buffet with hot selections for $12.99 (drinks included). My husband had the buffet once and said it was good. I ordered off the menu every morning and would go back just for that experience. The cinnamon french toast was amazing! We requested the same server, Raquel, every day since she was so friendly and provided great service. An extra touch she provided was sending us extra drinks in "to-go" cups when we were leaving. Keep in mind that Miami restaurants already add a 15% gratiuty to the bill. We didn't use the pool (directly behind the restaurant in a walled courtyard) or pay for parking since we didn't have a car. There is a concierge also which we didn't need. The elevator cars are a bit on the small side but we didn't ever have to wait too long for an elevator. Taxi's were easy to get just outside the front entrance. There is also a new CVS drugstore just a block down the street to the right of the hotel. There is a McDonalds behind the hotel (not such a clean one but we ate there...) a Subway around the corner and then dozens of places to eat at Bayside. The hotel was clean, in a great location, and overall, a great value for the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing rooms”
Reviews.Author: mistocean
Reviews.Content: Overall was an enjoyable stay. The room very clean and modern. Bathroom very clean. Room service forgot our silverware. Took the 1/2 hour to bring forks. Ice was almost water in glass. Had to ask for bread. Food was good. Breakfast was nice. they didnt have the juice we asked for but they did call and ask us for a second choice. we asked for breakfast at 6:45 but it came at 7. We had to leave by 7:30. Walls kinda thin if you are a light sleeper. Bed very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: swayze2626
Reviews.Content: I was a bit unsure about staying here after reading some of the other reviews, but I had nothing to worry about. I know that everyone's experience is different, but I didn't have any of the issues which other travellers reported. My wife and I were staying here for 1 night pre-cruise and it's location cannot be faulted. We were upgraded to a superior room (Room No.1001 on 10th floor) as I am a Platinum Priority Club Member. This has become the norm now, although it is always appreciated and never taken for granted. The room was spotless and although maybe a little basic, it was large and clean. I would have been happy to stay here for a week. I room had a large 6ft bed, fridge, microwave, tv, phone, sofa, desk, etc... We had a great view of the port and the Bayside Market place from the 10th floor. We were awake nice and early (5am), but this was due to the fact that we were on UK time (+5hrs). I spent an hour watching our ship (Liberty of the Seas) come in to port. There was no traffic to be heard or seen going to or from the port, like other travellers have reported. The staff were very polite and friendly all the time. Breakfast was included in our rate and was good. Lots of cereals, fruit, and hot selection, etc... We didn't have time to use the pool area, but it looked safe and clean. There was an ice and soda machine on our floor and would think they would be on all floors. Ice buckets, glasses, coffee maker was provided in the room. If you expect consumate luxury then go and stay at the Mandarin Oriental, but if you are happy with a large clean comfortable room (with free Wifi) and friendly staff then I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a pre-cruise stay. The Byside Marketplace accross the road has bars, restaurants (Hard Rock, Bubba Gump Co., etc...), shops and stalls. There is also a CVS 100 yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected....”
Reviews.Author: traveler8588
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Miami for a Royal Caribbean cruise. We decided to stay at this hotel after reviewing its specs online. When it comes to location, in relevance to the cruise, it was perfect. However, that was really the only positive aspect to our stay here. When we arrived, we were treated as 'second class citizens' (im guessing due to our young appearance.) The room was not ready at check in time so we were forced to wait in the lobby. Finally, when we were able to get in the room, my girlfriend realized she left here phone in the lobby. We immediatly returned to find that the phone had been stolen in the five minutes we were gone. The staff was less than helpful in assisting with this matter. Their only interest was in getting my safety deposit. Once in the room, we realized the specs online had been stretched a bit. (However bed was comfortable.) Our view was of the roof and at 7:00 a.m. the following morning, workers could be heard right outside our window with leaf blowers. Go figure. The last thing i feel i have to mention is the fact that the hotel charges for parking. We were told at check in that in our case, parking was to be comped. However, when checking out, sure enough, we were charged. Stay at your own risk and anything said to you by staff, get in writing.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST FOR PRE / POST CRUISE”
Reviews.Author: tony_105
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Holiday Inn Miami port for one night's pre cruise stay. Check inn was flawless as was express check out. The room was comfortable and well appointed, staff were extremely friendly and the location, across from the bayside mall and just a couple of minutes from the cruise port makes the HI Miami port a must for pre cruisers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay if Early Riser”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJudge
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price and location. The staff was super friendly. The room extremely comfortable and clean. The only downside -- which is not the hotel's fault -- is that it is just across the street from the Port of Miami. By 5 am, you can hear the trucks coming and going. If you're not an early riser, ask to stay in room away from street. Also, parking is limited, so you might not get a space if you don't check in early, and once you check in, you might not have a spot when you return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Before and After Cruise”
Reviews.Author: CAJulie_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel had mixed reviews, but we found it to be a wonderful place to stay before and after our recent cruise. Wonderful, helpful staff and nice clean rooms. Very good location...lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance (and even a new CVS Pharmacy on the corner). I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beau&KC
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night prior a Royal Caribbean cruise that departed from the port of Miami. Our flight arrived earlier than expected. They allowed us to check in 3 hours early and had a room made available. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. Just a short walk across the street was the Bayside Marketplace. There were many, interesting restaurants, bars, outdoor and indoor shopping, and live music. (We especially enjoyed the Miami Vice frozen cocktail bar which was right next to live Calipso Music.) We had an enjoyable evening and the next day received a complimentary breakfast before leaving. I really liked this hotel and it's location. I think it's a great place to stay before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Filled with tourists and cruisers, but a great location”
Reviews.Author: ThorntheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My second stay here in the last year, and my only disappointment was not getting my parking for free as I did last time. it's 12$ a day and the parking is not guaranteed, so you may end up paying the fee, but having to park elsewhere on Biscayne Blvd and paying the meters. You're right across from the harbor, with plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping all in walking distance. The rooms and staff are adequate, and as mentioned before, the elevators are slow, but you get there. There is an outdoor pool, and restaurant (neither of which I tried). I was there during the NBA finals, and spent those night at the outdoor patio at Hooters eating crab legs and watching the games. You're also a quick hop to the Brickell area, which has some higher end places to eat and drink - Try Oceanaire, it was pricey as all get out, but fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it should be better......”
Reviews.Author: trpetersons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Port of Miami....so they are packed full every night. They are the closest hotel to the port. The hotel is an older one but kept up. The staff we did not find that accomidating. They are professional....but definatly not smiling and friendly. You don't get the feeling that they are glad you are there. Just the opposite. They seem overwhelmed and hoping to get off soon so they can go home. Parking is VERY limited. They have a very small lot behind the building that has a stiff daily charge to use. With the port across the street, most of the patrons try to check out at the same time.....so check in and check out is intense and stressful. The in-house restaurant is pricey.... and the food is average. The waitstaff there is not real friendly either. We tried to order room service, but they close early with the restaurant... but the front desk staff did help us find somewhere that would deliver, so we could eat after a long flight. Our recommondation....if you are in Miami to take a cruise....this hotel would probably work out just fine for you. If you are there for other reasons.....you will most likely be dissapointed. You may want to consider some where else..... a bit further from the cruise port. I wish I had researched it a bit better, before I reserved our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great old building with comfortable beds and smiling staff.”
Reviews.Author: TexasGJ
Reviews.Content: If you need speed in your elevator, don't stay here. But if you want a super-comfortable bed, a very friendly staff, great location, and an overall tidy hotel, then this place will work for you. I'm just joking about the elevator. It works just fine. It just reminds me of the elevators in the old public buildings. I loved the location and my girl and I both loved the bed. The hotel was well kept and the people seemed to enjoy working there. Everything was clean and tidy. I hope the staff takes pride in the job they're doing and I look forward to staying there the next time I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Holiday Inn "tired"”
Reviews.Author: BLanceG
Reviews.Content: We came into Miami a day before our cruise out of Port of Miami and had seen Holiday Inn last time while we visited Bayside Marketplace. We thought "perfect location" for our next cruise. The location IS great, but the Holiday Inn charged WAY too much for rooms WAY too tired and dilapidated. While our "suite" did have 2 rooms, and a separate bathroom, it was circa 1959 and just "tired" looking and feeling. It was okay for one night, but, come on, at nearly $250 we really felt like we got InterContinental prices at Motel 6 accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...We will do it again!!”
Reviews.Author: artap
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night pre-cruise stay. This hotel just can't be beat for convenience! We walked across the street to Bayside, took boat tour of the Hollywood Homes, listened to live music, shopped and had great meals. Macy's and Walgreens is a couple of blocks away. Took cab to South Beach for one evening ($20). $10 cab ride to port. It will be a "no-brainer" for us in the future to stay at Holiday Inn Port of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Very good family stopover”
Reviews.Author: brady33
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five who stayed here on our last night in Miami. I chose this hotel as it could accomodate our family in one room instead of having to have to book two, which I have had to do on a number of occasions on this trip. We arrived at the hotel around 8pm and were given a large room on the 8th floor overlooking the bay. The hotel appeared very quiet and we did not see that many guests around. The view was great and the kids spent ages looking over the bay watching a big thunder storm that night. The room was spacious, clean and the pull out bed was great. Due to the storm that night we decided not to go out and eat in the restaurant, we were also able to use the $5 dollar voucher we were given as priority members. The food was fine and cost approx$130 with service. The pool looked nice but the kids did not use because of the rain. Used the internet access to chek in for our flight. On checking out they stored our luggage for us as we decide not to leave it in the car and they also allowed us to leave our car in the car park until 5.30pm that evening. On the recommendation of the guy near the front desk, we managed to see a bit of South Beach and Bayside before we caught our plane later that night. We also ate in Buba Gumps which the kids loved . Would stay here again as it offered great value for money. The room with view were excellent and it worked out as one of the cheapest hotel on our trip (approx Â£88 for the night - we paid nearly Â£250 for a night in Key West for a lesser quality room).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: masstraveler2
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near the Miami Port, close to the Cruise ships and the Holiday Inn was the perfect choice. As a Priority Club member our room was upgraded. It was perfect and the hotel is across the street from the Bayside Marketplace that has many restaurants and is nice to walk around. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Port; a $25.00 cab ride from the airport (15-20 minutes). I had seen some negative reviews on this hotel, so I had been skeptical, but I give it 5 stars out of 5. Great hotel! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Right where i needed to be!”
Reviews.Author: pepper1974
Reviews.Content: We took a ladies cruise from Miami. This hotel was perfect pre and post cruise stay! for those of you used to living in a mansion with butlers and maids, this hotel is not for you! But, for us regular folk who clean on own house and work each day, it'll do just fine. Food and bars right across the street, free metro in back of the hotel takes you to other parts of town. Taxi to the port (5 people) $7.50 :). Can't complain about that. Had no problem with towels, didn't use the pool though. There were plenty in our room we could have used those and called down stairs for more. I dont remember the names of all the staff but everyone was very polite, bell were great. They dont work before 7am i think? We left for our flight at 6:30am they were not there. If you going to take tours make sure you pick up a coupon booklet from the lobby they have great discounts and check online before you leave home you can find some there also. Bayside has enough to keep you busy for atleast 4-5 hours then another 3 after you eat to walk that food off! Over all if you have a bad experience here you may need to check yourself first to make sure your not nit picking over minor things. Remember this is not your home, it's a temporary room for a temporary stay! Going back 11/2009

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: misskdice
Reviews.Content: My husband, our teenage son, our five year old son, and I stayed one night here before getting on our cruise ship. The location is excellent. We checked in and walked across the street to the Bayside Mall which had a good variety of shops, excellent restaurants, and great bars and music. This hotel is right in the center of activity, yet it was a very safe area and quiet in the hotel. We had a suite which was large and comfortable. The pool area was kind of small, but totally acceptable. It is only a short cab ride to the port. We could actually see our ship from our hotel room window. Excellent place to stay, especially if you are cruising or even if you just want to have some fun.

Reviews.Title: “This is definetly a nice and comfortable hotel and great location.........”
Reviews.Author: majesticsky
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night after a cruise. Location was perfect - only $10.00 for taxi fare from the port to the hotel. Taxi can take you to South Beach for approx $15. Otherwise there's a bus located across the street that can also take you for less money. Hotel is located directly across from the Bayside Outdoor Mall. Many restaurants to choose from at the mall overlooking the bay. Live entertainment at the mall. Hotel pool was nice and plenty of lounge chairs to catch the sun. Room was plenty large for 4 people with addititonal seating. Everything looked clean - including the lobby. We arrived at the hotel early so the hotel held our luggage for us. Staff was friendly and helpful when we asked about ordering pizza and also getting to South Beach. They even gave us a coupon book for Bayside Mall. There is a bus route across the street to bring you to south beach. Oh yeah.....I found 2 computers on the 2nd floor for guest usage - I checked in online for our airline ahead of time! No additional charges for the computer usage. Your able to see the ships in port which was cool to watch. We had a great stay! Only thing was I thought kids eat free. But the hotel said because I prebooked the room I wasn't eligable and it was for kids 12 and under. Mine were 14 and 16. Anyways the breakfast buffet was $12.95/each. So instead of spending $50.00 for breakfast we ate at the airport for $20.00.

Reviews.Title: “Only for a night - if you must”
Reviews.Author: Kazza59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before a cruise. Excellent location for pre cruise and close to Bayside marketplace. Room was very tired, especially the bathroom. Airconditioning broke down and although there was a note on the bed to advise this on the first night it was still not fixed on the second night. The room was freezing cold and although a repairman came to our room it was not repaired and we both got bad colds from the experience. They deducted some money off the account however I would not stay there again.There were not enough towels available for pool users. The bar only opened after 5.00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zorro-plata
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for a conference (at the Hilton downtown) and chose to stay at the Holiday Inn because it is far cheaper. (Besides, I don't like being cooped up at conferences.) I'm pleased that I did as I found it a nicer place to stay. Sure the Holiday Inn is older, and definitely not as swanky (I had colleagues in very nice suites at the Hilton), but unlike the Hilton the broadband at the Holiday Inn worked, it was free (unlike the Hilton), there was a room with computers and free printing (unlike the Hilton) and just around the corner from lots of good restaurants (unlike the Hilton). I was pleasantly surprised that the hotel is very clean with no 'hotel' smell. (I had previously stayed in the Holiday Inn LAX that is not so clean.) I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller20099
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in early feb '09. The hotel is very nice, well located, nice neighborhood, very close to bayside market place, wich has nice latin restaurants. The room was very clean, the bathroom as well. The staff, although, were very unhelpful. We arrived at night, tired from a 4 hour trip from Orlando, carring like two dozen bags (we were 12) and there wasn't one single person to help us with the luggage. Not mentioning that there isn't a parking lot, so we had to find out at night where to put our rental cars, cause the staff wasn't able to at least tell us the best place to put them. We ended up paying too much for a not so good parking. Besides that, I would recommend it. It's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice friendly clean hotel for a pre cruise or any other stay.”
Reviews.Author: serendipity50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family pre cruise on the 25th of Jan ...[ which was our 34th wedding anniversary! ] and the hotel upgraded our room which was wonderful...it was very clean and the views of the Port and Bayside were fantastic. As it was Marathon day...it all had a really good feel everywhere..Iwould certainly go back in the future and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “glad only overnight stay!!”
Reviews.Author: hazel1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel Pre-Cruise in mid December. We didnt arrive at the Hotel until 1.00am after flying into Fort Lauderdale. There was nobody on Checkin desk unless he was taking a nap out the back office. Security let us in and then we waited till staff member came to check us in, we were then left to our own devicies and took our own luggage up to a room(which was the worst room I have ever stayed in) and my husband and I travel extensively! Carpet was filthy, damp musty smell in the room and even a coat hanger hook holding together the wardrobe doors. At that time in the morning we couldnt be bothered complaining because we were departing 10.00am next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: BillMcAdam
Reviews.Content: Lodged at this property prior to taking a cruise. Requested a high floor and king bed and was rewarded with both and a clear view of Biscayne Bay. Solid choice for those looking to stay in Miami pre or post cruise becuase cruise terminal is literally in view from your window. Nice shopping across the road at the bayside marketplace. Skip the continental breakfast/buffet and have your breakfast across the street. Nice dining options facing the bay. Room was clean, bed confortable and front desk helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: wysnaa
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 stayed here the night before our cruise. It was wonderful. The hotel put us all in one large room that overlooked the cruise ship pier. When we got up in the morning we could see our ship! Right across the road was a huge shopping center. When we arrived at the hotel our room wasnt ready they kept our luggage and we went across to the shopping center and had lunch. This hotel was a great location, with awesome customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: operman1
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Port of Miami was great choice as a pre-cruise hotel. The view I had from my room afforded me the opportunity to observe the cruise ships at the port. I also had a great view of the Bayside Marketplace. The room was very spacious and I had a very comfortable bed. The restroom was very clean and had everything I needed to get ready for my cruise. This hotel is a great value for someone who is either going to the port for a cruise or staying in Miami for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of cruise ship, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kaf1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami for one night before taking a cruise on November 13. Check in was a breeze - we got a room on the top floor with a port view. The room itself was more than adequate - comfy bed, lots of room and seating options (a chair and ottoman, a table with 2 chairs and a rolling desk chair). We had dinner across the street at Bayside at Hard Rock Cafe. It was wonderful to be able to cross the street and be somewhere nice. We awoke to the view of our cruise ship docked at the port - adding to the excitement of our trip! We ordered breakfast room service prior to going to bed for the night. We called the restaurant directly - do not use the hang card, there are not many options on there. It was delivered the exact moment we requested it and everything arrived hot and fresh. This hotel met our expectations. No, it's not fancy, but it was great for a short term stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel before cruise”
Reviews.Author: lives2shop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights before our cruise. We arrived late (after 11pm) and didn't have any problems checking in. Our room was nice with a view of the bay. I thought the beds were comfortable and I didn't have any problems with noise. The hotel is right across the street from Bayside Market Place so there are plenty of places to eat and you can do some shopping. We ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast both days, it was a nice meal but I felt it was overpriced. Overall I thought the hotel was nice, clean and in a great location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: airforcegirl
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of this property I wasn't expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived at 9:45 am and asked if we could leave our bags there until check in, they gave us a room right away.. The location and view was amazing, right across the street from the Bayside market place and close to the beaches. I loved everythings about it. Thank you Holiday Inn, we loved Miami and your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Port of Miami Great for Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Rieba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an old building but was clean in lobby and room. Pool is undergoing renovation. You can walk to the Bayside Shopping area which has restaurants/bars and a food court. There are also souvenir type places and shops such as Guess. You cannot walk to the the ship terminal as the bay separates the hotel/shopping area from the port. It was a $12.00 cab ride (two people) from hotel to ship terminal. Breakfast buffet at hotel was typical and cost $12.95. There is Macy's etc. 4 blocks from hotel but we did not check it out. There is a McDonalds within walking distance of hotel. Neighborhood around hotel is seedy.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised at holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: 71bronc
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Holiday Inn pre-cruise for two days, based on some of the reviews here I was a little worried, I was pleasantly suprised the Holiday Inn was clean and my room was comfortable. The location is ideal, right across the street is bayside marketplace, they have music , numerous stores and restaurants it's also a short taxi to the port. Only one issue.. they were re-modeling the pool area during my stay so the pool was closed (kids were disappointed) and parking was a pain because the contractor re-modeling the pool was also using the lot for parking which meant less parking spots for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: bananasue37
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel almost 1 year in advance. We had stayed here 2 years before and had a great experience. This time was a bit different. The hotel is getting a bit run down. We had requested port view rooms and only gave us two rooms with port view. The other two rooms faced the McDonalds in the back! The carpet is getting worn. The tile in the bathtub was stained. I am usually a big fan of this hotel because of location location location! But I probably won't stay again. The restaurant was around $12 per person for breakfast. So we walked to McDonalds around the corner instead. If you consider this hotel, I wouldn't stay more than one night. The positives: directly across the street from Bayside Marketplace and close to Port of Miami. If you have port view, you can see your ship in the morning. Perfect location for cruisers. Easy to get a taxi in the morning. The negatives: The hotel is getting older. Many people paid less for the much nicer Intercontinental a few doors down. The staff wasn't too friendly or accomodating. There is plenty of noise from the street below and the music at Bayside Marketplace. Housekeeping was lacking. One of our rooms had a couch sofa bed, behind the couch was plaster (or something white and crumbly) from the walls all over the floor. It was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: henepup
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were wonderfully surprised with the friendly service. Jennifer was very professional, she answered all of our questions. Our room was on the 8th floor facing the port, great view of our cruise ship. When I booked this hotel I requested a room on a higher floor just for the view. The pool area was small but very comfortable. We used the business center, its on the second floor, it was very clean. I also used the laundry area on the third floor, the in room flyer claims that its $1.50 per load. Its not, it was $1.50 to wash and $1.50 to dry, plus a $1.50 for detergent. The beds were very nice and comfortable. The shower and nice pressure. We couldn't have asked for a better location. We also ate breakfast in the dining room. The breakfast was very good. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: giachig
Reviews.Content: Good quality and cleanliness, suitable for families w/children and couples. It is not far from SoBe. Breakfast not too complete Hotel parking was full and we moved to a street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel for you?”
Reviews.Author: DJT...DJT...DJT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to the shopping and restaurant area which was across the road. The check in was efficient and the small pool area was good to keep cool. The room and bathroom were clean and were of a good standard for the class of hotel. However I cannot recommend this hotel as it has very thin walls and this means that a good nightâ€™s sleep is impossible due to the amount of noise. We were continually awakened by noise from through the walls and also from above and below. If a good nights sleep is important â€“ well this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unpleasant..”
Reviews.Author: NorcoRider08
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 6th floor had a nice view of the ocean. But while we were there a big group of 150 teen tourists arrived from Brazil and had absolutely no manners, the worse thing about that the staff did not do anything about their rude behavior. If you want to stay there DO NOT go to the restaurant, you will not be happy with the food. The restaurant is only good for the breakfast buffet. There were also a few good things about the hotel. It was close to a beautiful beach and had a nice outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “ok for 1 nigth”
Reviews.Author: pax101
Reviews.Content: we were for just 1 night, for shopping between flights. The staff was very kind. The check in time standard of hotel is at 3 pm, but we arrive at 11 am asking for leaving the baggage there while we went shopping and the have happily surprise us with the room already available!! The room is good, spacious and mostly clean. The bathroom a little old or without charm, but ok. The bad thing: the air condition was extremely high (not just in the room, also in lobby, elevator, all over!!), we turn it off but it wasn't enough.. Another contra: they don't have a parking, so you must walk.. I recommend the one is in the Bayside (across the street), not cheap but safer than others, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Holiday Inn Port of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Leebird6531
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night. It was for the night prior to boarding a cruise ship. The room was worn and dirty. Room walls needed some fresh paint, windows were dirty, sleeper sofa in room was broken and sheets on it were musty and crinkled. Not sure if it had been slept in and the sheets changed or not. Hotels in the area are expensive. I guess you get what you pay for, because this was a little cheaper than many of the other options near the port. Good points: You can see the cruise ships from the rooms that face port side. Parking was free. Sandwiches from the bar that we ordered and ate in our room were good. The bar staff members were nice and visited with us while we waited on our food. Would we stay here again: NO

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: UCFKnightsFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property from May 13 - May 16, 2008 for a conference that was taking place at Miami Dade College. This hotel was perfect. It had free internet access in the room and was within walking distance to Miami Dade College, Bayside Marketplace, American Airlines Arena, and Downtown Miami. The front desk staff was friendly, knowledgeable, quick, and efficient. We had breakfast one morning at the restaurant. The food and service were both great. The room was comfortable and clean. The only negative thing about this hotel is the parking. The parking is EXTREMELY limited. I would stay at this hotel again if the need arises. It was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: cgassler0804
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Holiday Inn Port of Miami in May '08 with 4 other people. We took a shared ride shuttle from Ft. Lauderdale airport, which cost us $18 pp. The room had 2 full size beds with 1 pull out queen sofa. There was plenty of room for the 5 of us for 1 night's stay. My only complaints would be that the room was a little stale smelling, but it was horrible. The location of the hotel was great for us. It is located directly across the street from the Bayside Market which is a big outdoor mall, with places to just hang and listen to live music. There wasn't anything else within walking distance, other than Miami Heat Stadium. The hotel was pretty crowded, but we didn't have any trouble checking out the morning of our cruise. There were a few cabs lined up outside the hotel and it was only a 5 minute ride (about $6) to the port. I would definitely stay there again if I were cruising out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “holiday inn bayside”
Reviews.Author: gfargo53
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 1 nt. pre-cruise for april 3 2008 and were very pleased with the hotel.we arrived at the hotel at approx. 11:30 am which was 3 hrs. prior to their published check in time. we had booked it 3 mo. in advance and requested a room with a bay view but were told the rooms with a view were not avail.so we were given a room on floor 5 with no view.but we were allowed to go to our room at that time which was a plus to us as we wre tired from our flight.the room was small but very clean and we were happy with this hotel and if we stay in the miami area in the future we will gladly stay here again.we got a coupon for $5.00 off the breakfast buffet because of being priority club members and really enjoyed the breakfast.walked outside next morning to grab a cab to the pier at 11:am and were at the ship 10 mins.later

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and staff very helpfull”
Reviews.Author: FamilyDunedinnz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel over 9 hours late as we had big flight delays leaving Auckland New Zealand. Our arrival time was expected to 10pm in the evening but we did not arrive until 9am the following morning. The staff where extermly helpful and synpathetic to our sirtuatiuon. They allowed us access to our room so we could shower and and freshen up before our cruise left and a late cheeck out of 1am. We had breakfast in the hotel resturant and although it was costly if was execellent. This is a great hotel to stay pre cruise and the views from the hotel of the port are great.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: thompstone
Reviews.Content: Good location for a pre-cruise hotel. I used hotel points to book this stay. I'm glad I didn't pay what they were asking. The hotel is older, so the room could have used some updating. The sink fixtures were loose, the wallpaper looked like it needed to be redone, and the general condition of the room added to the look of age. The Bayside area across the street came alive at night, so there's plenty to keep you busy. There are many restaurants, including Hard Rock, and many shops. Our room did not face the Bayside, so we did not have any noise issues. But the front desk did indicate that when bands play, that side of the hotel does get noisy. The hotel bar is small and so is the outdoor pool. The restaurant looked okay, though i didn't eat there. Taxi to the hotel was $25-30. Taxi to the pier was $15-20. I'm likely to look for a different hotel in this area the next time.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and location was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: cuizercalgary
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip away from Canada so we were a little scared and new at the whole traveling bit. Needless to say our luggage somehow lost us on the way and we showed up at the hotel around 1am with nothing. We let the front desk know about our luggage and we were told it would be all taken care of should our luggage show up. The hotel staff offered us toothbrushes, toothpaste and other amenities to tide us over until morning. The hotel is right across the street from Bayside market - PERFECT location!! We had a ton of fun eating, shopping and eating some more. When our luggage showed up the hotel tucked it away nicely for us and waited for us to get back to the hotel. Check out was quick! Cons: The view wasn't the best, we looked onto a parking lot...but hey, we were going on a cruise in a couple of days so we didn't care. The only issue we had with the room was the sound of a clock on the street - some grandfather sounding thing...bing bonging at 5am...not so great when we didn't get to sleep until at least 230am. Rather far to malls - paid $40 to get to Dolphin mall

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay Precruise!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl422
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night precruise. The room was very spacious. The hotel is in a wonderful location. There are many places nearby. We found a Starbucks and Walgreens nearby. The Bayside Marketplace is really nice and is directly across the street from the hotel. I would've liked to have spent a little more time there. We got in late on a Sunday night so many shops were closed or in the process of closing. The area around the hotel is a business district during the day. It felt safe at night going to the Bayside Marketplace as many people were around. I don't think I would walk anywhere else around the other side of the hotel at night. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was horrible.The food was average and the service was horrible. I think the gratuity is already included, so they care lttle about providing good service. i guess they think that they'll never see you again. The hotel is nice though and i would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “street noise unbearable!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia67
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night before leaving on a cruise. The hotel was packed. Our room was ok, but nasty black mold on the shower curtain. We faced the port and shopping area, and the entire night we were kept awake by honking horns, sirens, etc. We were on the 9th floor. Noise finally stopped around 4 am. We were exhausted for our first day on the cruise. They had a decent buffet only breakfast, and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: navigator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to taking our cruise. Right opposite Bayside market place and the AA Arena. It is less than 10 mins by cab to the cruise port approx $16. Miami Int airport to hotel is approx 15 mins late night $23. Check in was fast and friendly. Good lobby area for waiting for anyone with plenty of seating. Room was a good size with a safe and large closet. Bathroom was clean but small. We were at the front of the building on the 6th floor. Great view but the noise in the early hours of Sunday woke us up. Especially the shouting at 6am-7am. If wanting a good nights sleep then ask for rear of hotel room and forget the view. If you are cruising then take this advice. Get your bags down stairs before 09.30. After that then be prepared to wait, sometimes up to 30-35 mins. They only have 2 elevators and come 10am, everybody is looking for them. You can leave them with the concierge and return for them before leaving for the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Starfire_rules
Reviews.Content: Our group consisted of three women getting away from it all, including the snow. We arrived at the Holiday Inn Friday afternoon. We were half way into the door before we were helped with our luggage. Which didn't bother us at all. The check in was uneventful but fast. The lobby is nice with a small resteraunt straight ahead as you walk in the door. We were taken to our room which was on the seventh floor. Compared to other Holiday Inns we have stayed in it was a little cramped. Considering this is Miami, we just went with it. Our window didn't face the port but the view was still beautiful. The pool was difficult to find. Next morning we ate at the resteraunt. The service was a lttle slow but the food was good. I recommend getting the buffet instead of ordering. Most of what's on the menu is on the buffet. You can bring your luggage down to have it put aside until you leave. We went out to the curb and waited for a van/taxi to pick us up. This took a long time. After ten minutes we were about to give up when a van showed up to take us up over the bridge to our ship. All in all, a nice hotel. Very close to Bayside Marketplace. Traffic managable. Will definately stay again for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: RetiredandLovingItII
Reviews.Content: High priced, rooms very much in need of refurbishing, no internet (as advertised). One plus, the shower worked and thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre-cruise - but eat at Bayside”
Reviews.Author: cloudbase
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday Inn in the Port of Miami. The location is great - a five minute taxi to the cruise ships and across the road from Bayside which has lots of shops and bars with lively music and a nice atmosphere. One morning we sat at a cafe watching the pelicans and the dolphins swimming in the harbour. We had a room with a fabulous view across the bay. The room was clean with comfortable beds. Slightly damp from the Miami humidity - no heating so you need to switch off the air con to secure any warmth at all on chilly winter nights Staff are great and very helpful, especially Jairo the Bell Captain who goes out of his way to assist - and will book exactly the tours you want. The evening meal we had was not very good but Bayside across the road has loads of choice for food. Would recommend this as a short stay for cruises - great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler24NewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect for anyone going on a cruise. We stayed after our cruise. You can see the Port of Miami from the hotel. Bayside is across the street with great entertainment and great food options. Front desk not very friendly. The hotel is not new, but did its purpose for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bardswalk
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Port of Miami is very central for both the city and the waterfront . The Metromover is two minutes away and is free! The staff are excellent and the rooms facing the bay have wonderful views. There is a nice outdoor pool with loungers. A good choice when visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mississauga4
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review as I sit in the hotel room so I don't forget anything. I stayed here once before a few years ago precruise. I wasn't impressed then but I hoped it would be a bit better this time around. We get the stay free through reward miles. If I had to pay I wouldn't stay here. The walls are paper-thin. I can hear the conversation going on in the room next door. I've lost count how many times I've heard doors slamming. It was freezing here the other night. Tried turning on the heat only to find out the hotel doesn't have a heating system. Froze under blankets all night. They never bothered to make up the room at all today, nor did they do any of the rooms of the other people in our party. We had to go down to the front desk to ask for more towels and toilet paper. When people are arriving and departing for the ships the wait for the elevators and check in/check out can be very long. Their staff is friendly enough and the bed is comfy, and contrary to one of the other posts I read there is free wifi in the room but that's about as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before boarding our ship for a cruise. The hotel is good value for money. The location of the hotel is very convenient and you can see the beautiful port of Miami just from your room. In order to do that make sure you tell that you want an ocean view room when you arrive. Those rooms are also larger. I would not recommend to have breakfast at the hotel. In front of the hotel there are several places were you can have a good breakfast for half the price. There is also a Hooters, where you can order nice King crabs at reasonable price. The service at the hotel was friendly and in overall we had a good impression. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonablly priced and in a good location pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Be_as_you_are
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 5th floor with a great view of the cruise ships at port and also of the Bayside Market Place. We had fun walking over to Bayside and ate at the Hard Rock Cafe. (I HIGHLY recommend the Mango Chicken Quesadilla!! YUM!!) It was a very short cab ride to the port, but be prepared for a lonnnnng wait at the elevators in the morning while everyone is trying to check out (use express check out) and get to the port. We were on the 5th floor and waited about 10 minutes for an elevator and even then, we had to split up. We shared a room with another couple who we cruised with so we could split the cost. We had PLENTY of room - with 2 doubles and a pull out couch. I recommend this hotel. It is in a good location with lots to do over at Bayside all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Outdated, but GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: TallahasseeMark
Reviews.Content: OK, I have stayed here 6 nights during the past year. The hotel is a little dated and maybe needs to be modernized, but you simply cannot beat the location if you have business downtown or are taking a cruise. The port of Miami is directly across the street and the view of the cruise ships is fantastic. Rooms are about $200 per night, plus taxes and parking. Not a bargain, but try some of the many surrounding hotels and compare the price. No wifi but they do have a "bridge" which allows in room internet access. Small, 2 computer business center. Hotel food in reasonably priced and very good. Concierge is a wealth of information. Front desk customer service can be irregular, depending on the staff on duty. Few restaurants in the vicinity except across the street in the Bayside Marketplace...and many of those restaurants are very good (Latin Cafe, Hooters, etc).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bctraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were going on a cruise the next day. Location was excellent for this. The market across the street was fun and easily accessible from our room. The area was a bit run down, but other than that a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: embandjhb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn at the Port, pre cruise, on Jan. 1. We arrived around 1:00 p.m and when I requested a port view, she said we were upgraded to a suite. Nice. We had a separate bedrom ,living room and small kitchen area with micro, frig, sink etc. It ws nice to have the extra room but since it was just a one night stay, not necessary. It was clean and VERY quiet. Considering they were full, amazingly so. We were given a free buffet breakfast too, which was average. Filling. Being right across from Bayside was nice, as we spent the afternoon and early eveing watching all the activities. There is a liquor store nearby so we were able to get a few bottles of wine for the cruise. (We cruised on Oceania which allows you to carry on whatever you want. ) The front desk was helpful and the trip to the port was only ten dollars. A decent hotel pre cruise. Nothing real fancy but location is what sells it. We'd stay there again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “great pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: canfamg
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at prior to a cruise. The location was very good, across the street from the Bayside Market place. The rooms are small but clean and serve their purpose. Parking is limited and at an extra cost per day. Hertz rental car is just around the corner from this hotel and offers a free shuttle to the port of Miami. Very good shuttle service pre cruise but very slow when debarking(Others in our group booked Hertz and had a hard time get ting a shuttle post cruise). It cost us $15.00 to get a taxi from the port to the Thrifty car rental in South Beach and took us only 30mins from the time we left our cruise room to the time we arrived at the car dealer. Did not eat at the holiday inn restaurant but it was always busy. Lots of restaurants in the area including a McDonalds just out the back door of the hotel. Would stay here again if we were to book another cruise out of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and affordable”
Reviews.Author: JordanF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in December. It was pleasant and affordable, with decent parking. The best feature is that it is right across the street from the Bayside Marina Mall. This gave us an easy place to go for food, hanging out, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bully-o
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Holiday Inn for 1 night prior to our cruise. The hotel is located right across from the Bayside Marketplace & has a wonderful view of the Port. We were given a 9th floor room with a lovely view of the port. It was cool to see our ship from our window in the morning! We arrived earlier than the posted check in time, but luckily our room was ready & we were allowed to check in. The front desk staff was very friendly & helpful. Our room was clean & comfortable. We were right across from the elevator but I didn't hear anything like I was afraid I would. With the Bayside Marketplace across the way, there was plenty to do within walking distance. The hotel has a nice pool & dining room and we were given a card for a discount on breakfast the next day. We could not get on our ship until 1:30 so we had a few hours between check out & leaving for port. The hotel stored our luggage for us so we could kill time without hauling all our stuff with us! Overall our stay was very pleasant and we would stay here again before cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Local Entertainment”
Reviews.Author: shandychanel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday Inn pre Cruise with my wife and 2 children for the second time in two years. This hotel is located across from Bayside as others have posted and makes it easy to get a meal and do some walking around the shops. When staying at this hotel you should be made aware that if there is any type of entertainment at Bayside or the venue next to Bayside and you have a room facing the Port....IT WILL BE EXTREMELY NOISY UNTIL ABOUT 2:00 IN THE AM. Since staying here the first time I inquired about any "events" happening when making this booking and was advised that none were scheduled. Upon check in I asked again if any "events" would be happening during our stay and again told that nothing was scheduled. Low and behold there was an event with extremely loud music which started at 8:00 and lasted until past 2:00 AM. Contacting management I found out that in fact the hotel did know of this event, but SOMEHOW had failed to notify their employees?????? Management did compensate our bill for the inconvience which was appreciated, but it made for a very long night. Listed below is personnal insight. 1) This hotel is located in Downtown (which is dirty) and is approx $20.00 cab ride to Port 2) No grocery store within the area 3) Liquor store 2 blks from hotel (expensive) 4) Elevator's are small, book a room on top floor to eliminate long waits 5) After talking with cabbie's found out that South Beach is about 20 minutes away but if you stay on a weekend and drive or take a cab to South Beach it could take over an hour due to traffic 6) Good breakfast bar 7) Port facing rooms have a great view of ships (Freedom Of The Seas)(especially if you are awake when it arrives in the early am)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: As has been stated before, this hotel is all about location. I booked kind of last minute, so I ended up paying about 160$ for a 'king bed room with queen sleeper sofa'. For me as a solo traveller I felt the price wasn't exactly cheap. But the room although looking old was very spacious and clean and would very comfortably house a family of four. Or even four grown ups, if you cosy up a bit. So for families or people say on a party trip this is an affordable, very conviniently located place to stay. Plus I am sure if you book a little more in advance you're bound to get a better deal. My check in was a very smooth and friendly affair. And although I stayed on a weekend and the hotel was obviously brimming with pre-cruise guests my room was ready despite me arriving early. My only complaint: The aircon although I turned it on warm was freezing at night as the temperatures had just dropped and couldn't be turned off. They also put some water and a few chocolates into my room, which was a nice touch. The room also has a coffee maker, a microwave oven and a fairly big emtpy fridge and even a freezer, again ideal for families. So if you're going to be on the cruise of your life and you want to start or end it in style, go to the Intercontinental across the street. But if you are on a budget or you just don't see the point of spending 400$ on a hotel room, no harm in staying at this well run Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryB4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami one night before our cruise. The hotel is very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is free internet access.. The beds were quite comfy. The smallish pool area was also clean and a pleasant place to sit and enjoy drinks. Drinks were not available until 5:00 PM. Breakfast was available in the hotel restaurant, the buffet was $10.95 per person. There is also a McDonald's a block away in back of the hotel. The only complaint I had was that the coffee at the hotel was terrible! We were 3 women going on a cruise so we got a room with 2 double beds and an extra cot. The cot was $10.00. Our room was very large and easily accommodated the cot. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right across the street from Bayside Marketplace. A nice spot along the bay with many restaurants and shops. There was live music playing on the Sunday night we were there. It was a nice way to spend an evening before our cruise. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for night before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Claire_cardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for our 1 night stay before a cruise. We had a room on 9th floor overlooking the port, so could see our cruise ship. The hotel is opposite the Bayside marketplace (1 minute walk) which has a few nice shops and restaurants - we ate at the Hard Rock cafe there. It is also in walking distance of the shops on Flagler Street (Downtown) although don't expect much here. Due to the rainy weather, we didnt get to use the pool, but it looked nice. The breakfast is good value for money, a good buffet and pleasant dining room, with loads of coffee for your $2. The check in staff were friendly, and there was no waiting for information. A good hotel overall, would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: nynymom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the HI POM with 8/9/07 pre-cruise and this hotel more than met our needs. I booked 4 rooms for the 14 people in my party, we had 1 king & 3 double rooms all with sleeper sofas, and each of the double rooms were spacious enough to accomodate up to 4 people and the king room up to 3. We arrived much earlier than the posted check-in times and they were more than happy to give us our room, the only thing was all rooms couldn't be on the same floor, which wasn't a problem for our group. My room was located on the 9th Floor (901) and we had an excellent view of Bayside Marketplace & the Ships in port!!! The room was clean and odor free, we did run into a small problem with our door not locking and all it took was a call down to the desk and within 15 minutes someone was there to fix it. I will definately be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: ollyillinois
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night before going out on our cruise on July 25,2007. I would highly recommend this hotel as the price isn't to bad and the hotel was nice and clean! I travel alot and am very particular about my rooms. I had NO complaints what so ever!! Excellent location and there is a VERY nice area with shopping and LOTS of places to eat right across the street!! Lots of nightlife with music outside!! Nice place to unwind after airports all day!! They have sleeper sofa's in some of the rooms which I had a hard time finding at other hotels. If you ask for a late checkout they will give it to you! A cab is easily accessed for your trip to the port!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Night Before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: tsimmons2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Saturday, June 30th, 2007 for one night before our cruise the next day. This is the perfect hotel to stay at the night before your cruise leaves. The hotel is right next to the Port. A short cab ride over to the cruise terminals the next day (Royal Caribbean was our cruise) only cost like $10. The cab ride from the airport to the hotel is approx $30. The Bayfront Shopping Market across the street from the hotel is great. We ate at Lombardi's Seafood for dinner in the Bayfront Market place and it was wonderful. I highly recommend the restaurant. There is lots of shopping in this Market place and at night, it comes alive with entertainment, music and people. They have a Hard Rock Cafe, a Bumba Gump Shrimp and other nice little bars to visit and the bayside of the market. This hotel is clean and nice. Ask for a room up high, you will be able to see the cruise ships in port, which is really cool. My husband and I had a king size bed room. It was up to standards of Holiday INn. Nothing special but nice & clean. The hotel restaurant served an "okay" buffet breakfast. The hotel will check your luggage into a secure room if you have to check out and wait until its time to go to the boat. We used this service and that worked out really well. We checked out, left our bags at the hotel and went across the street in the morning for a little last minute shopping before the cruise. In short, I recommend this hotel very much if you are going on a cruise that departs from the Miami Port!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: bjoklahoma
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday and stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami. The hotel was great for our pre cruise stay , although it would be good for any stay. It was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly. They have a restaurant with a good breakfast buffet and our sonâ€™s was free. It is just across the street from Bayside Marketplace and only 5 minutes from the Port. The Bayside Marketplace has lots of restaurants, cafe's and shops. It was nice to be able to just walk across the street for our evening entertainment. There is a concierge at the hotel who was helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcfaddensfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year at the end of September before a cruise, but I've just never gotten around to writing a review. So long time coming, here it is: I booked this hotel through their web site, and put in a request for a room on a higher floor with a bayside view. Since I was just paying for a regular room, I wasn't sure if that would be honored. But when we arrived I was pleased to find out that they did honor that request and we had a great view of Bayside Marketplace AND the port of Miami. (Very important when you're taking a cruise and want to wake up in the morning and see your ship there waiting for you.) This isn't a "fancy" hotel, but it was great for what I wanted. We were staying in Miami for two nights before leaving on our cruise. My son and I felt safe in this hotel and walking across the street to Bayside. (We even ventured down the block and around the corner to the People Mover so we could take the Metro line to the local museum. A little less safe feeling once we ventured away from the hotel & Bayside, but still was a nice little trip.) The rooms were nice, not too worn, but we couldn't get our windows open. (Maybe they're afraid of jumpers??) Be aware that if you are a light sleeper, you may want to bring earplugs because the doors automatically slam shut when you walk out of them and the banging can be heard from inside your hotel room. All around, I'd say it's a good place to stay before your cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!!”
Reviews.Author: courtaz
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because at the time it was the only one that could accomodate 5 individuals. I read the reviews posted here and crossed my fingers. We arrived at 3:30 and the hotel was bustling but the staff handled it quite well. I requested a room on a higher floor and only had to wait 10 minutes before it was ready. The desk clerk was courteous and very helpful. The room was neat and clean. We did not use the pull out couch as the person slept on the couch but stated she was comfortable. Loved the fact this hotel is across the street from the Bayside. It was very easy to walk across the street to eat and shop. We were here during the Heat's final playoff but never felt the area was crowded nor loud The view from our room was spectacular. We woke up the next morning to see not one but two cruise ships (one had our name on it). When checking out we found the lobby was chaotic but the concierge was cool, calm, and comptent. He arranged car service for our ride to the pier. I give this hotel two thumps up

Reviews.Title: “Don't go on a Saturday night!”
Reviews.Author: SLN209
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews & wanting something convenient prior to our cruise. The room & hotel is fine. It was nice to walk across the street to visit the shops at the Bayshore Marina. However, on Saturday nights there is a constant blaring noise from the kids on the street with the music from their car steros. It continued until 1 am! The windows in our room were rattling! The hotel staff said it was a "concert" night - but talking to the locals, they said it happens each weekend. We were a group of 4 couples & one couple had a room not facing Biscayne Blvd. Their room was a lot quieter. We recommend that you request a room away from Biscayne Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Downtown Hotel...Period!”
Reviews.Author: snowbeltOH
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 7 times in the last year....you simply can't beat the proximity to the cruise port, American Airlines Arena and Bayside Marketplace. Clean rooms, and we love the bayside view rooms. We won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “We really injoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Shortyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our cruise. We requested a view of the port and was rewarded with a wonderful view. The market place across from the hotel was very nice to go out for supper. the only negetive thing we can about the hotel was the restuarant. we had breakfast in the morning, my husband and I shared a breakfast. The waitress just abuot threw a fit, it must of affected her tip that they automacticly put on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, but don't bring your car.”
Reviews.Author: entreri313
Reviews.Content: Booking the hotel was very easy. The good things about the hotel are it's close proximity to Bayside, the American Airlines Arena, and Bicentennial Park for the Ultra Festival. Both were in very easy walking distance. If you are lucky to get a hotel room high enough and facing the street and the bay the view is wonderful. The worst thing about the hotel is not enough parking! Had I known that there were only about 30 places to park and that we would be charged $12 a day to park there, I would not have rented a car. When the when the lot is full the security staff and front desk are absolutely no help and couldn't care less what you do. You are supposed to park in a larger lot next door, and pay the lot people directly. You do need to let the staff know that you are parked there so you can be reimbursed for that night. However, if there is a special event going on in that area (in our case, a Miami Heat game) the parking fee for the lot next door (which is normally $12) shoots up to $40!!! There are a few parking ramps in close proximity, and meters out in front of the hotel, but you may not park there overnight. The staff is very aloof as well.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: CBCHMBRLN
Reviews.Content: i always read reviews before booking any trips and have learned that you can take some of the reviews with a grain of salt..that being said, i have to say my husband and i are picky. i pre-booked this hotel a year ago and it was non refundable, so i was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews. we don't care if the room is 5 star but we can't tolerate bad customer service which was a major complaint in several reviews...we found the staff to be extremely friendly and as accommadating as anyone could be..the hotel was clean, the room was huge. we requested a high bay facing view and thats what we got. we had no problem getting elevators and the breakfast was a very nice buffet which was kept stocked and hot....bayside across the street has several wonderful restaurants. this was a great way to start our cruise vacation and i would most definitely return..the room was a little musty, but hey, you are in south florida..ps today i received a nice email from the holiday inn thanking me for staying there....if you have any questions, email me at cbchmbrln@ aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: hemea
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed one night pre-cruise in Jan. I booked nearly 9 months in advance and asked for high floor with view and got 3rd floor, no view. Can't hurt to ask. The hotel is in need of some serious updating and the front desk staff was less that helpful , including when we asked about a post office or stamps. Sent us on a wild goose chase 5 blocks away. The room was okay for 1 night with the exception being that the couple in the room next door were having an escalating fight that started about 10:30. We finally called the front desk when it sounded like it might get physical, and they sent someone up and the argument stopped until the next morning about 6:30 AM! Walls are VERY THIN. The couple on the other side were entertaining in regular voices but we still could hear their conversations. The service was very slow in the bar. Bartender was distracted by the room service phone she apparently was answering that evening. We did not eat in restaurant. Bayside Market is directly across the street and would recommend it for eating, drinking, shopping and people watching. We stopped a several outdoor bar/grills and enjoyed watching the ships come and go. Walgreens is several blocks down for anything you forgot. Next time we will spend the extra and stay at one of the nicer hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: R&R-in-Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise, the staff were not friendly, half of them didn't know english, most were spanish speaking. The room we had was horrible, we had asked for a queen or king, we ended up with 2 double beds which were so uncomfortable. The halls smelled of water damage, the walls in our room had water damage on them, with bubbles in the paint. We stayed there 2 nights because we had paid for it, after the first night, our room had not been cleaned yet and it was 4:00 in the afternoon. We don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with staff”
Reviews.Author: SugarCreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for our trip to the Orange Bowl. The property could use some maintenance and the attitude of the staff could definitely use some improvement. Two out of the three nights there was no parking available for us. The night we returned from the football game, the guard who was locking up the hotel parking lot actually told us to "go away"! We told him we were hotel guests and had paid the $12.00 parking fee and he still told us to leave! We were left to find alternative parking after midnight in what can only be called a "dodgy" part of Miami. I would not recommend this hotel based on location, facilities and staff.

Reviews.Title: “close to cruise line nice hotel let down by rude and agressive staff”
Reviews.Author: calconnor66
Reviews.Content: my party of 9 arrived tired and hungry after a long journey from Orlando we were not allowed to book in til 4.00pm, staff not interested that I had a young baby I needed to see to. Head waiter was a rude aggresive misogynist , who clearly had ideas about his own importance. Shouted at us across a packed resturant and abused us in Spanish to one of his collegues, stupid man as I understood every word he said, When I complained to the manager I was offered free breakfast, however he did not apoligise, he continued to give me filthy looks and posture around the resturant . Was so incensed by his behaviour escpecially to my elderly aunt that I wrote a written complaint before I left. But have not heard anything. Hotel is well located for criuse ships, and although could do with some updating was.fine for one night. However I took my sons to the pool whilst we were waiting to book in, and after a while it filled up with black insecta that looked like beetles or roaches. Took my sons out of the pool and complained nothing was done for a few hours and they merley scooped them out and said it wold be fine.I would ot return until they gave there staff accourse in customer service as the hotel on the whole is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Miami !!!!! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: chicashopper
Reviews.Content: As I write you , I have just arrived home from the Holiday Inn, Port of Miami. It was the most comfortable, the best location. My husband , My 2 kids and I were in town for the WWE wrestiling, and just stayed overnight. The staff was wonderful, the parking was a little cramped but hey at least you know your not parking in an empty lot. The room was so clean, didn't smell, and the bed, usually I can't sleep because the bed is just horrible. But I was pleasantly surprised and the great nights sleep I had. We splurged and got the 1 king bed and sleeper sofa suite, and it was soooo worth it. We are already planning a weekend trip. This was the perfect location, I went shopping at Bayside right across the street, great shops, great food, and their is a really nice starbucks their. Again, in the end, PERFECT is the only word I can use to describe the staff, the hotel, and location..... I loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Just Watch Calls”
Reviews.Author: Martha2020
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but DON'T use the in room phone to call international, the rates are HUGE! Buy a phone card in bayside and call from a pay phone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hebridian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before a cruise. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Our room was on a high floor and overlooked the port and gave a good view of the cruise ships. Breakfast was buffet style and plentiful. If you join Holiday Inn Rewards scheme before making your booking you'll receive a discount on the hotel food. Check out was at 11am which made the lifts very busy and we witnessed some queues. However, we checked out at 9 and stored our luggage at the hotel which has hassle free. The shopping centre opposite the hotel is great for a one night stay. Shops, bars and eating places. Would stay at this hotel again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “convenient in staying pre-post cruise”
Reviews.Author: nat819
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by calling holiday inn because their website was not allowing us to book. To our surprise when we arrived at the hotel, they had booked 2 rooms instead of one and since the rate was non-refundable they didn't want to reimburse the second room. After waiting 15 minutes while the staff member spoke with the manager, they did credit our account...however they did not apologize and made it seem like it was our fault and they were doing us a favour. Otherwise the hotel is very convenient if you wish to stay a day pre or post a cruise. Bayside Marketplace is across the street...shopping, restaurants, entertainment and boat tours are found there. We were told by locals to stay at bayside and not go to downtown miami after 6pm as it is dangerous. The taxi to the port is a flat rate of $10. The taxi from the airport around $35. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, bathrooms brand new. BUT walls were paper thin and everything could be heard from our neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: CPUK
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel seem somewhat mixed but we were very pleased with it. We arrived at 7.30.pm after a Transatlantic flight but without our luggage which decided to spend an extra day at Heathrow. The lady on check in was very kind and gave us a large bag of toiletries saying we could keep any we didn't use. Check in was quick and efficient and my requst for a higher floor room overlooking Bayside was provided. We stayed here 4 nights prior to a cruise and whilst Miami isn't really a city break destination this is very good for that purpose being opposite the shops and restaurants of Bayside and a very short stroll around the corner to the Metromover which takes you for free all around Miami including about 4 stops away right to Macys door literally! We didn't eat at the hotel other than breakfast which was fine. The service, cleanliness, comfort of the beds and condition of the hotel were good also. We hired a car and parked in the secure staffed area to the rear (which has direct access to the hotel via the swimming pool area). Overall, whilst not having any gimmicks or flash facilities this proved to be a pleasant and relaxing start to our holiday and as such is recommended for someone wishing to be in the downtown area - though not, of course, near Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SimonBenson
Reviews.Content: The start of a 10 day break in Florida and we really couldn't have booked a better starting point. Reception staff were friendly and speeded us through so that we were in our room within 10 minutes - great view straight across Bayside Marketplace and Bayfront Park. Room was clean and considering the location much larger than we were expecting - one king bed with the remaining space taken up by sofa, table, chairs etc where another king bed could have gone! Restaurant is OK... dinner menu is quite limited and one or two strange combinations but the food was good (we really didn't fancy venturing out on the first night after a 9 hour flight). Breakfast is typical Holiday Inn, either served as a buffet (weekends I think) and regular HI breakfast menu the rest of the time. All in all an enjoyable place to stay in downtown ideally placed for shopping and people watching at Bayside - and don't forget the boat tours of "Millionaire's Row" available directly opposite. The Hotel is also only minutes from the cruise terminals of the Port of Miami, and around 20 minutes from the airport (plenty of roadworks and building going on while we were there), and just a short distance to the new Carnival Center for Performing Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and nice location!”
Reviews.Author: October222006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre cruise, and it was wonderful!Everyone was very nice to us, it was a clean room which is very important to us more than anything else.My husband and I had never been to Miami, so we were hoping from reading all the reviews that we picked a good hotel and this hotel met all our requirements.We also liked that we were right across the street from Bayside and we were able to go to the outside mall, since we didn't have any experience in Miami we were not sure of our surroundings and was not sure if it was safe to go out at night, all we had to do was go out of the hotel and walk straight and we were able to eat and go to the mall.I would recommend this hotel to anyone, we really had a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ELD702
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise on April 8, 2006. We checked in around 9pm on a Saturday night and was given a 10th floor room overlooking the port and the Bayside Marketplace which is right across the street. I signed up for the Holiday Inn Rewards club when I made the reservation through the ichotelsgroup website so upon check-in I was given a card for $5.00 off any meal purchased in the restaurant. Our room was excellant - looked like they could have fit 2 queen beds in it but we only had 1 king bed - sheets were clean and linens were clean, so no complaints at all about the room. Checkout on Sunday morning was a madhouse -- if you have lots of luggage I would suggest asking for a room on the top floor - we didnt have that much luggage but as the elevator made stops at each floor and the doors opened, we saw the frustrated looks on people's faces from floors 9-2 that seemed to me like they had been waiting for a free elevator for a looooong time. NOTE: there are only 2 elevators...2 very small elevators. Breakfast in their restaurant was okay - you could choose to have the breakfast buffet or order off the menu. The buffet was alright - my fiance had the skillet breakfast from the menu and he found it very tasty. There is a walgreens about four blocks away from the hotel that we walked to easily. I would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
