Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of April prior to going on a cruise on Brilliance of the Seas. I had read the previous reviews and was not expecting a great hotel but thought it would be adequate for two nights. It was actually much better than I expected. Check in was quick and efficient. Both elevators were working and my room on the 9th floor was excellent. Room 904 has a wonderful view of the Bayside Market. It is a non-smoking room and has a huge queen size bed. As a Priority card holder, I was given a card that gave me $5 off meals in the restaurant. The continental breakfast buffet was very good value at $7 - just incredible with $5 off! Best value breakfast I have ever had. The free internet service in the Business Centre on the second floor was working. I booked the hotel through the Holiday Inn website and the total cost with tax for the two nights was US$233.04 (Can $275.01). The Bayside Market is just across the street and is a fun place to visit. The free air conditioned Metro Mover is close by and is a great way to get around downtown Miami and to connect to the subway system. I used it to go to visit Vizcaya - a trip well worthwhile doing When I checked out, there were many others also going on the cruise so we were able to share taxi rides. This is probably not the best hotel to stay at for a weeks visit to Miami but for a couple of nights prior to a cruise, it is perfect. andrew

Reviews.Title: “Great Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: canner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Carnival Victory Cruise. I had booked the room about 3 months in advance and got the Sail Away Package. I had requested a room on the highest possible floor and with a view of the Port. I was not disappointed. Our room was on the 8th floor and looked out over the Bayside Market and the Port of Miami. Our room had 2 double beds, usual table and chair, desk and chair, and coffee pot. There was a large window in which we could watch the people coming and going from the Market as well as watching the ships leave and enter the port. This was the reason I had booked this hotel. I wanted to see the port and to watch when the Victory came in. Check-in was a breeze and there was a bellhop to help with our luggage. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and provide menus for those restaurants that provided delivery. There was a business center that offered free internet access, however this did not work the day we checked in. Before checking out, I did step into the business center and was able to check online the status of the ship and departure time due to Hurricane Wilma making it's way to Florida. Breakfast was great, a wide variety of things to enjoy and the wait staff was very pleasant. Was fun to watch and see all the people who were staying there getting ready to cruise. After we finished with breakfast, the wait staff offered us foam cups to take coffee and juice back with us to the room. I have read some complaints about noise, but did not hear any. Our room was located near the end of the hall so that may have been the reason. The only noise to speak of was the firework show that happened Saturday night about 9:30. This did not bother us and we actually enjoyed it. There was a RCCL ship in port that was getting ready to set sail so it seemed like a great send off for them. As, I said, the reason for booking this hotel was to watch the ships come in. About 3am I woke up and decided to take a peak out the window, sure enough, the Carnival Valor was arriving. Talk about fun to watch as it made it's way in to the harbor and turned around before docking. I got up several times and was able to see the Carnival Victory as well as RCCL ship arrive. Check-out was again a breeze with several cabs waiting at the front door. We checked-out about 9am as we like to be to the port early. This hotel is not a newer hotel and there are signs of wear, but it is in good shape and was clean. I did not smell any weird smells, nor saw any bugs and I am one to take notice of such things. If you are looking to stay several days in Miami then this hotel may not be for you as there is not much other then the Market around to do, however, for a pre or post cruise hotel, it is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim-N-Sue
Reviews.Content: If you are going on a cruise and plan to arrive in Miami the day before your cruise this hotel is an excellent choice. If you are going to stay more than one or two nights choose another hotel. The positives to this hotel is that it is incredibly close to the cruise terminal and is right across the street from Bayside market which is a fantastic place to spend a day. We found the room to be very clean and the king sized bed was very comfortable. The downsides are that other than Bayside market there is nothing else around to visit and the downtown area is not all that nice to walk around. The doors in the rooms have automated closing devices and the doors slam shut which is very loud. All in all not a great hotel but its location is just too good to pass on.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed here before a cruise in Jan. 06. Maybe we were just there at a bad time. One of only two elevators was working, which was difficult when everyone was trying to get out of their rooms and down to the first floor at the same time. Had we not been in a hurry that morning, it wouldn't have been that big of a deal. We ended up walking our luggage down six flights of stairs. The breakfast (and service at breakfast)was terrible and expensive. Either they don't have heat or the heat didn't work. I know that usually you don't need heat in Miami, but that night it would have been nice. Again, I'm sure we were just there at a bad time. It was in a nice location for us since we didn't have a car. It's right across from the Marketplace with shops and restaurants so that was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service For a Moderate Sized Group”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This January 2006 my husband and I got married on a cruise and stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami with our 50 guests the night before. The hotel staff was efficient with check in and check-out, and went out of their way to help us with special accomodations at the last minute. The hotel even posted our wedding on their bulletin board in the lobby. The rooms were clean and the concierge was helpful. The Bayside Marketplace offers a variety of shops and restuarants, though the hotel does have its own restaurant. Our party did eat breakfast at the hotel. It was just "okay" and the price was a bit high for the selection offered at the buffet. It was very comfortable and convenient though. Overall, our entire group's experience was amazing and we would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is perfect if you are going on a cruise, however be mindful that the hotel does not provide shuttle service to and from the airport or the port for cruises. Still it is only a few minutes and dollars away by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RealMccoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before departing on a cruise. We redeemed a free night from the Priorty Club which holiday inn participates. This hotel is about 15 miles from the Miami airport which is not bad in a taxi. We shared the ride with another couple and it cost about $24 ($12 apiece). We arrived before check in and the hotel was able to stow our bags. They provided luggage tags and gave us tags to match. They placed the luggage in a secured room. We went across the street where there is the bayside mall. We were able to listen to free music at the pier and have our pick of many places to eat like Hard Rock Cafe and Bubba Gumps. If you go to the Hard Rock and are a AAA member you can get 10% food and t-shirts. They have boats where you can take a 1.5 hour boat ride to see the sights. I think it was about 15 a person. We got back to the hotel at noon, which was still early for check in and we were able to get a room. We were informed that my husband was chosen for the Priorty Club member of the day and we were upgraded to a suite. The suite was located on the 5th floor on the corner so we had a great view of the cruise ship pier and the bayside mall. The room was tastefully decorated and it was clean. The king sized bed was comfortable enough. There was a safe in the closet and the AC worked fine. There was a seperate sitting area with an additional TV and telephone. A microwave, fridge and coffee maker. They provided popcorn, bottled water and coffee at no charge. My only complaint about the room was the toilet. It rocked back and forth. This was a livable problem so I didn't care. We were given a voucher for a free buffet breakfast the next morning. The dining room was crowded so I'd suggest that you would go earlier than we did which was around 10am. The food was decent. They had hot food and danish as well. You could order from the menu if you wanted. AT this holiday inn as at many kids eat free. We thankfully were able to travel without our kids this time so it didn't apply to us. If you do drive there you will be charged a per night parking fee. The hotel had an outdoor pool which was not very big but fine for a dip. They had a nice exercise room with two treadmills, an elliptical trainer and a bike along with some weights and a scale. The equipment was fine but the readouts on the elliptical were not correct. Our cab fare to the cruise ship pier was less than 10 dollars and was a very short ride. All in all our stay at this hotel was very pleasant and comfortable. We would stay there again and would highly recommend it to anyone who was going a night pre-cruise as this hotel is a perfect location and much less expensive than the hotels the cruise line trys to sell you pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: DPenkala
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Holiday-Inn Port of Miami and it really is a very convienent place to stay if you are planning on boarding a cruise ship the next morning. The hotel is right across the street from Bayside Market place, which is a fun place to get your "cruise" week started with good food and live entertainment. The rooms are decient, but like a fellow reviewer stated, I couldn't get any heat in a rather cool room. I think if I were cruising during some of the warmer months I would rather stay at a hotel right on south beach, but for the cooler months, like January, the Holiday Inn suited me just fine.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay...”
Reviews.Author: melann26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami. It is a pretty budget type hotel. It did have this musty smell throughout the room and the hallway. The concierge Daniel was very helpful and the Bayside Marketplace across the road was convenient and it is open till 11pm every night. I prob wouldn't stay here again. I would prob pay a little more and stay somewhere a little nicer. It is a 10 min bus ride away to South Beach. It's good if you are staying a few nights - but that is it. We loved Miami though!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dlostyle77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and son for one night post-cruise. The hotel is decent, but the rooms were very cold. Normally, the cold might be welcomed in Miami, but not when the outside temperature is in the 50's, as it was the night we were there. We got the Best 4 Breakfast rate, which included a $20 credit for the hotel restaurant's (overpriced) breakfast. It was OK. I would recommend it only if you can get an advance purchase discount rate of $90-100. With parking, I paid a total of $160 for the night, which was too much for this average hotel. Additionally, the Bayside Marketplace across the street is little more than a mall food court with a few souvenir shops. Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. does have good food, however.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for One Night”
Reviews.Author: audaciousred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami for one night before our cruise. It was fine - clean, close to the port and across the street from Bayside Marketplace. If you want to go to South Beach, a cab will run about 17 bucks. If we were going out of this port, I would stay again as long as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for one night...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just OK, not great or nothing to really talk about. But if you are taking a cruise and want to be close to the Port of Miami this hotel will do. The rates are good, but don't spend or waste your money on getting a Suite if your only going to be there for one or two nights it is not worth it. The Port of Maimi is very very close.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to see a concert at the American Airlines Arena, and this was the least expensive place within walking distance. Perfect location with free parking and in/out priviledges!! You really can't beat that. After the concert, it was nice to just be able to run across the street to the Bayside Market, which is right across the street from the hotel. I had actually tried to get a room for both Sunday and Monday night, but Sunday was sold out. At 2am Monday morning, we were in town and called the hotel just to see if we could park there (and pretty much sleep in our car) because check-in wasn't until 3pm. The woman at the desk said I could check in to our room without paying for an extra night! At 2am!!! That was a Godsend. I couldn't believe how accommodating they were to our situation. Besides free parking, food right across the street, a business center and workout room, our room had a refridgerator and effeciency kitchen, iron, and everything we needed to have a comfortable stay. The rooms are clean, although the hallway carpeting is worn and the halls can smell a little stuffy. You can't beat the price and location if you're going to the AA Arena or on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Oct. 28th, prior to our cruise. It was just one week after Hurricane Wilma. I was worried the hotel would be closed but I called just 2 days after the hurricane and the front desk assured me the hotel was open and had no damage. Our flight to Miami was early morning, so we arrived at front desk by 9 am. Our room was not ready yet, so we had breakfast by the pool, which was small, but very comfortable with tables, chairs and chaise lounges, surrounded by a high wall and palm tree plants. They play piped in music out there all day...sometimes can be loud, but we got used to it because we liked the selected songs. By 11 am our room as ready. We were on the top floor (10th) but not facing the harbor. We faced the pool. The room was not large, but well appointed and had a nice little full bath that was very clean with granite counter top, wall mounted hair dryer and tub/shower. It all looked recently renovated. Had a nice large armoire that housed a large tv and a desk and club chair next to it. There was also a safe in the closet and iron/ironingboard. Plenty of pillows on the bed too. The hotel lobby is nice and so is the restaurant/bar. At 5 pm they have Happy Hour and we enjoyed the drinks and sat by the pool. there was an 8pm curfew because of Wilma, so we pretty much spent the evening on hotel property. But, earlier in the day we walked across the street to the Bayside market and just loved it. had lunch outdoors overlooking the harbor and saw cruise ships parked nearby. There was also live Salsa music outdoors and many outlet shops and various other restaurants. It was very festive. We went down to the breakfast buffet at around 8:30 am and there were no lines at all. The food was very good. We had a leisurely breakfast and took a cab to the pier at around 10:15. There were 4 of us and we paid 10.00 for the cab. Speaking of cabs, if you take one from the airport to the Holiday Inn, the fare should not exceed 21.00 (before the tip). Make sure you let the driver know this before you get into the cab. Some drivers will try to take you for a joy ride and charge more. Our friends had this experience and were charged 38.00! So beware. if you do not feel comfortable taking a cab from the airport, there is the Super Shuttle which charges around 9.00 per person to the hotel. You do not need a reservation. Just walk outdoors from the baggage claim and the stand is right there next to the cab stand. We will definitely stay at this hotel again prior to a cruise. It is the best value and the closest hotel to the ships and Bayside Market. The two other hotels that are nearby are the Intercontinental and then Marriott on Biscayne Bay....a few blocks further than the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alleah
Reviews.Content: I had booked this room through their website and the location of this hotel and the price i paid for cannot be beat. We had a room on the 9th floor and the view we got is just amazing. We stayed here for our pre-cruise and the location is just perfect. Close enough to go to the Bayside market to do some last minute shopping and plenty choices of restaurants where you can eat. There is also a Walgreen few blocks down if you need something else. 9th floor doesn't have a vending machine or an ice machine but just go down one level and you should find it easily. I agree with the other critics.. you can hear the slamming of the door. If that doesn't bother you, then this is a place to stay. For less than $100, there's nothing to complain about. We paid $10 going to the port the next day and taxi is so easy to get. They are always outside of the hotel waiting for passengers. I guess they know that people use this hotel to go on a cruise. I really can't say anything else bad about this place cuz we only stayed there for one night. We never tried the restaurant because there are plenty of restaurants across the street and the atmosphere down there is more lively. I would definitely come back to this hotel for our pre-cruise stays.

Reviews.Title: “Going on a Cruise? - GREAT Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zacloed1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in large part based on the reviews we found here. We stayed for 2 nights before our cruise. Check-in was hassle free. The room was smaller, but really - it was nice. Granite countertops and nice shower head in the bathrooms. Huge closet (all those cruise bags, right?). Bayside was right across the street - there were numerous restaurants - including Hooters, Bubba Gump, Chilis. There were also traveler shops, food court, standard shopping, etc. Near the hotel is also a Walgreens for any last minute things you need. Taxis are out front waiting to take you to the cruise port. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: jj824
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in September for pre-cruise. We booked the hotel thru the Holiday Day Inn website, and requested for a room away from the elevator (from the reviews here about the noise) and 6th floor and up. However, we got a room that's on the 5th floor, right across the elevator! We requested a room change but was told that the only room that's away from the elevator has no view of the port...so we stayed. The hotel room is decent, great for a 3 star hotel. Sheets & the washroom are clean, about 30 channels on TV, and got all sorts of things you'd expect ie. coffee maker, safe, phones, etc. However, one of the phones didnt work but there're 2 in the room so that's ok. Also, one of the lights didn't work so it made the room darker. Although we stayed right across from the elevator, the noise didn't bother us at all - just a slight "ding" sound when it arrives. However, I agree with others that the doors are very noisy when shut, and the walls are very thin that you can hear your neighbours. However the real noise is from the traffic below - at 5th floor with windows shut, I'd still hear the cars passed by below...as well, there was noise from the toilet - as if it flushed by itself. Had to close the lid & bathroom door...took a long time to fall asleep. If noise didnt bother you, this is a great place to stay. Price is reasonable, and the location is great - Bayside is just across the street..2 minute walk. Staff were very friendly and helpful too! $23 tips included for a cab ride from MIA. On safety, it's better than expected - it was a concern since we were 3 female travelling. But we arrived at around 6pm and went to Bayside, walked back at around 9pm...the market & street were lively with lots of ppl still, so dont need to worry about walking back at night. However, you do see homeless ppl on the street (as with every cities' downtown) but it's not as scary as I thought. All in all, a great place for pre-cruise but mind the noise! Would recommend staying at least higher than 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Michina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Port Miami in the middle of August. This hotel has an excellent location right across the street you have one of the most visited spots "Bayside". The hotel is nice, not too fancy but has all of the elements to make it a 3 star hotel. The staff is pleasant and "Hugo" the Concierge is very helpful... The rooms are big and some are renovated. Beware, if you reserve here try to ask for the rooms that face Bayside they are more spacious and updated. I've stayed here in June and was given a room facing the port. Those rooms were much nicer than the rooms on the back. This time around, they put us towards the back of the hotel and the view was nothing to write home about. Also ask for King size beds... the double rooms have full size..who fits on a full size nowadays??? We paid $120.00 for the night, that included breakfast for two.. so in the middle of August thats a great deal. Also bare in mind that parking is extra.. I don't understand why, but that is Miami for you... The parking is limited on top of that so you may not have a spot secured if you arrive to late.. oh and they also close the gates after midnite, so ask if you will be arriving late. There's much to do at night right across the street so you may just want to park and walk... they have bars/ restaurants/ and live music every night... The hotel's pool is not big, if you want to get some sun you need to wake up early as the sun disappears quickly over the building. Some of the rooms need improvement, but overall clean... the hotel has a great location and price which is better than staying at the hotels in SoBe.. Oh another thing if you are not driving, save your money on cab fare as they will charge you about $25.00 each way to take you there. Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose this hotel due to its close proximity to the port since we were going on a cruise the next morning and because the Bayside Marketplace was across the street offering shops to explore and several nice restaurants to eat at. The hotel was nice. We were very pleased with the room itself, especially the bathroom. Just off of the lobby is a nice dining area and bar. I had a delicious breakfast the morning we checked out to leave for our cruise. Our ONLY complaint was that it was very difficult the sleep because of all the slamming hotel room doors. All of the doors have automatic spring closers, which cause them to slam shut. We stared at the ceiling for hours unable to fall asleep because of all the noise it was making up and down the hall. If it werenâ€™t for this I would give this hotel 10 out of 10 points. Being used to Super 8 and Motel 6, I would say this was a very nice hotel but because of the trouble sleeping I would probably pick another place next time.
